text:
‘How does the digital transformation affect 
organizations?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital 
Transformation: Insights and Implications for 
Strategy and Organizational Change
André Hanelta, René Bohnsackb,*, David Marzc and 
Cláudia Antunes Maranteb
a University of  Kassel; b Católica Lisbon School of  Business & Economics; c University of  Goettingen
ABSTRACT  In this article we provide a systematic review of the extensive yet diverse and frag-
mented literature on digital transformation (DT), with the goal of clarifying boundary condi-
tions to investigate the phenomenon from the perspective of organizational change.
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON'), ('Organizational Change', 'ORG'), ('Hanelta, René Bohnsackb', 'ORG'), ('David Marzc', 'PERSON'), ('Cláudia Antunes Maranteb', 'ORG'), ('University of  Kassel', 'ORG'), ('Católica Lisbon School of  Business & Economics', 'ORG'), ('University of  Goettingen', 'ORG')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Organizational change and development’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
A Typology of Perspectives on Digital Transformation
The two aggregated thematic patterns of DT (i.e., towards malleable organizational 
designs and digital business ecosystems) summarize the content of DT, which focuses on 
‘the substance of contemporary organizational change’ (Armenakis and Bedeian, 1999, 
p. 295).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The perspectives vary in their contextual scope and focus on intra-organizational change 
processes but share the commonality that they associate organizational change with the na-
ture of digital technologies, particularly their pervasiveness and the dynamics they induce.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
However, as we discussed 
previously, change processes in the course of DT are driven not only by organizational 
actors, but by a confluence of organizational, technological and environmental forces 
in digital business ecosystems (El Sawy et al., 2010).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
What is unique to DT and going 
beyond the boundaries of established perspectives on organizational change is that, due 
to the traits of digital technologies underlying the new organizational design and digi-
tal business ecosystems, even these episodic episodes lead to new phases of continuous 
change in organizations, which may endure for a comparably long time.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Linking our findings and interpretations to existing work, we find that the 
nature of DT is only partially covered by conventional frameworks on organizational change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Who or What is Driving Digital Transformation at Your Organization?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Holistic co-evolution
•	 How do internal change initiatives (e.g., by institutional entre-
preneurs) of particular organizations radiate throughout digital 
business ecosystems and shape their gestalt?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Information technology and organizational change: Causal structure 
in theory and research’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Revamping your business through digital transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Thus, the participants within digital business ecosystems, their posi-
tions, and their roles are subject to constant change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
DISCUSSION OF FINDINGS
Although our findings portray DT as complex and diversified, we can abstract directions 
concerning the content of organizational change (Armenakis and Bedeian, 1999).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Organizational change: A review of theory and research in the 
1990s’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Unpacking the dif-
ference between digital transformation and IT-enabled organizational transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Handbook of  Organizational Change and Innovation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Works following this perspective contribute to 
research on DT by yielding insights into how organizations transform their organiza-
tional design in accordance with the surrounding evolving digital business ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, technology structuration theories (Orlikowski, 2000) might be valu-
able for tracing the consequences of interactions with digital technologies in relation 
to organizational change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
We define 
DT as organizational change triggered and shaped by the widespread diffusion of digital 
technology.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Keywords: digital business ecosystems, digital transformation, organizational change, 
organizational designs, systematic literature review
INTRODUCTION
Digital transformation (DT) is increasingly establishing itself as a constant theme in con-
temporary academic and practitioner conversations.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ), Handbook of  Organizational Change and Innovation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
And, how does DT relate 
to existing knowledge on organizational change?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
From this basis, we derived two aggregated 
thematic patterns concerning the content of change: first, we found that DT leads to 
a shift towards malleable organizational designs which enable continuous adaptation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
As we pointed out, DT involves, on the one hand a shift toward malleable organizational 
designs that enable continuous adaptation and on the other, toward turbulent digital 
business ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘How big old companies 
navigate digital transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Therefore, the phenomenon is naturally con-
nected to the topic of  organizational change, viewed as a ‘difference in form, quality, 
or state over time in an organizational entity’ (Van de Ven and Poole, 1995, p. 512).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Instead, DT seems to have a more intricate and encompass-
ing connection to the topic of organizational change, requiring a broader view of and 
comparison with the literature on organizational change and innovation (Poole and Van 
de Ven, 2004).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Our findings indicate variation in 
the extent to which studies focus on intra-organizational processes of change, i.e., the 
mechanisms in Figure 2.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Finally, our work aims to support managers to respond to the strategic 
challenge of DT (Singh et al., 2020) by revealing important insights on the shifts towards 
malleable organizational designs and digital business ecosystems that may inform orga-
nizational change and strategy practices.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
[Culture change theory]
•	 How do changes in digital business ecosystems alter power 
relations (e.g., between different functions or units) and value 
commitments inside of firms?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
•	 How can new theories, inductively derived in the con-
text of DT, explain organizational change?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In Poole, M. S. and Van de Ven, 
A. H. (Eds), Handbook of  Organizational Change and Innovation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In Poole, 
M. S. and Van de Ven, A. H. (Eds), Handbook of  Organizational Change and Innovation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In Poole, M. S. and Van de Ven, A. H. (Eds), 
Handbook of  Organizational Change and Innovation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In Poole, M. S. and 
Van de Ven, A. H. (Eds), Handbook of  Organizational Change and Innovation.
entities: [('Poole', 'GPE'), ('M. S.', 'PERSON'), ('Van de Ven', 'PERSON'), ('Organizational Change and Innovation', 'ORG')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
That is, malleable organizational design places a premium on constant 
adaptation and change in correspondence to the environment (Huang et al., 2017), and 
the digital business ecosystems in which organizations are embedded are characterized 
by their ever-evolving and turbulent nature (El Sawy et al., 2010).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Digital transformation strategies’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
DT perspective
Phenomenological advancement
Theoretical advancement
Systemic shift
•	 How do new digital organizational forms (such as platform-en-
abled peer-to-peer networks) emerge and become institution-
alized across contexts?
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In 
general, these studies do not provide insights about how organizations arrive at malleable 
organizational designs but reveal particular forces from digital business ecosystems that 
alter certain parts of organizations.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘The digital transformation of traditional business’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Thus, we define DT as organizational change that is triggered and shaped by the wide-
spread diffusion of  digital technologies.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Thus, the focus of many past 
studies on change within an organization, e.g., in relation to the adoption and use of en-
terprise IT systems (e.g., Volkoff et al., 2007), seems insufficient.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Linking our findings to the established knowledge on organizational change, we diagnose 
that DT can be best understood as continuous change that can be triggered and shaped by 
episodic bursts, while the latter are inducing further continuous change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Some studies in our consideration set put more emphasis on 
change processes driven by developments outside of a firm’s direct area of control, such 
as the increasing diffusion of AI, robotics and the Internet, and described their effect 
on organizational design, without dealing in detail with the intra-organizational change 
involved to bring about these effects (e.g., Evans, 2017).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Therefore, in this study, we set out to 
clarify the boundary conditions for investigating DT from the perspective of organizational 
change by conducting a systematic review, synthesis and abstraction of what is known about 
DT and relating these insights to the established body of knowledge in the field.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Digital transformation: Opportunities to create new business models’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
IMPLICATIONS
Digital Transformation and the Nature of Change
According to Poole (2004) the nature of change ‘defines how one divides the field of or-
ganizational change and innovation theories.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
On the 
basis of 279 articles, we provide a multi-dimensional framework synthesizing what is known 
about DT and discern two important thematical patterns: DT is moving firms to malleable 
organizational designs that enable continuous adaptation, and this move is embedded in and 
driven by digital business ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
It should be stressed that each and every 
perspective assumes organizational change in association with the widespread diffusion 
of digital technologies.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
related to digital business ecosystems and their relation to organizational designs, to being 
‘broad’ in scope and examining both thematic patterns of DT in a more holistic way.
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON'), ('DT', 'WORK_OF_ART')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The technology impact perspective on DT combines a weak focus on intra-organizational 
change processes with a narrow contextual scope.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
When employing the DT perspective of systemic shift, continuous views from popu-
lation and community ecologies (Baum and Rao, 2004) seem adequate for investigat-
ing how new digital organizational forms (Hinings et al., 2018) emerge and become 
institutionalized across fields and ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
DT, for instance with regard to synthesizing divergent interests both within organizations 
and digital business ecosystems.
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This dimension can vary along a 
continuum from a ‘weak focus’ to a ‘strong focus’ on intra-organizational change pro-
cesses, depending on the emphasis placed on an organization’s innovation and integra-
tion mechanisms as drivers towards malleable organization designs and digital business 
ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘The significance of context in information systems and organizational change’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, 
our analysis of the organizational change literature was tightly coupled to the distinction 
of episodic vs. continuous change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The systemic shift perspective on DT is employed by studies that have a weak focus 
on intra-organizational change processes, as with the technology impact perspective, 
but combine it with a rather broad contextual scope.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Third, we propose linkages between the phenomenon of DT and established views in 
management literature on organizational change and innovation and derive important 
avenues for future research.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Due to the uncertainties about the phenomenon, it is currently unclear whether, and if 
so how knowledge on organizational change can be used to explain DT.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
pervasive in recent work and sufficiently central in the conceptualization of change’ 
(Weick and Quinn, 1999, p. 362).
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON'), ('Weick', 'GPE'), ('Quinn', 'GPE'), ('1999', 'DATE'), ('362', 'CARDINAL')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In summary, this perspective provides insights on how firms partially adapt their organi-
zations to specific developments in their digital business ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
•	 How do well-known relationships between institutional 
upheaval and organizational change hold when organi-
zational design becomes malleable in the course of DT?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Explaining development and change in organizations’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Accordingly, to clarify 
boundary conditions to investigate DT from the perspective of organizational change, 
it seems promising to contrast our findings with the characteristics of episodic and con-
tinuous change, particularly with respect to the ‘different metaphors of the organization, 
analytical frameworks, theories of intervention, and roles attributed to change agents’ 
(Poole, 2004, p. 5).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Hence, studies following this perspective help us 
to understand the peculiarities and evolutions of digital business ecosystems as a whole 
and their impacts on organizational designs.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Second, this shift is embedded in and driven by digital business ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Hence, the ideas and topics related to DT such as automatized, data-driven and virtual 
business processes or ecosystem-oriented and embedded organizations are not simply 
academic, but of high relevance in practice as well since they provide insights into key 
questions of organizational change and strategy such as how to adapt organizations, 
 14676486, 2021, 5, Downloaded from https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/joms.12639 by Capes, Wiley Online Library on [30/04/2025].
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, the change towards a 
malleable organizational design is embedded in and driven by digital business ecosystems 
and cannot be considered in isolation from this.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Within digital business ecosystems, 
however, the value propositions pursued can change radically in a short period of time 
(Yoo et al., 2012).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘The art of continuous change: Linking complexity theory and 
time-paced evolution in relentlessly shifting organizations’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Though, especially in the beginning of DT and 
due to the unpredictable evolution of digital business ecosystems in later phases, change 
agents from the perspective of episodic change will also be necessary.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
[Dialectics theory]
•	 How can we extend institutional adaptation theories 
to account for the turbulent nature of digital business 
ecosystems and the resulting dynamics in environmental 
demands?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For instance, the internal change processes of an organization from a pipeline towards a 
platform company may significantly shape and be shaped by the business environments, 
partner networks, etc.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Finally, we derive a substan-
tial research agenda on the basis of our analysis of the fit between the phenomenon of 
DT and the established literature on organizational change and innovation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
At the same time, however, the phenomenon of DT also seems to present an oppor-
tunity (and necessity) to advance the existing body of knowledge about organizational 
change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
A Research Agenda for Digital Transformation
In what follows, we provide several avenues for future research by combining the insights 
yielded by our systematic review of DT in relation to the nature of change (see previous 
section) with the perspectives of our typology (Figure 3).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Relentlessly changing organizations have been 
identified in software industries (Brown and Eisenhardt, 1997).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Towards Digital Business Ecosystems
Drawing upon the manifold changes that our review has revealed with regards to an-
tecedents and outcomes, in conjunction with the emergence of malleable organizational 
designs that dynamically tune firms to their environments, we can identify a move towards 
digital business ecosystems as the second thematic pattern of DT.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘HR’s guide to the digital transformation: Ten digital economy use cases for transforming 
human resources in manufacturing’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
A promising avenue for this is the approaches that synthesize linear approaches 
of organizational development with cyclical change theories (Marshak, 1993).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Such a view enables us to potentially explain 
the phenomenon of  DT and its management in business practice by drawing on the 
robust and diversified knowledge base relating to organizational change and innova-
tion (Poole and Van de Ven, 2004).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
However, such theories should be adapted to account for the 
changing impact that external actors, drawing on divergent values, rules and resources 
from outside the organization, might have on the firm when interacting through shared 
digital technology.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
While prior research studied organizational change in relation to information 
technology (IT) (Markus and Robey, 1988; Orlikowski, 2000; Volkoff et al., 2007), the 
latter defined as ‘computer-based technology for the storage, accessing, processing and 
communication of information’ (Molloy and Schwenk, 1995, p. 283), and created valu-
able and persistent knowledge, recent observations suggest that DT deviates from these 
past organizational changes in at least the following ways.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Developing a digital business strategy, digital acceleration and digital mobiliza-
tion help to unfreeze the organization for swift transformation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Therefore, according to our findings and to consider the process of change, we refer to 
the intra-organizational process dimension as the extent to which intra-organizational pro-
cesses of change are accounted for in studies on DT.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Due to the increasing turbulence, digital business ecosystems are ‘changing the rules 
of the game in many industries through disruptions of business models’ (Pagani, 2013, 
p. 617).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘The nine elements of digital transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
On the basis of this analysis, we derive a research agenda and provide managerial implications 
for strategy and organizational change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
How do implica-
tions for organizational change shift?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Also, from an episodic perspective, theories about technological discontinuities 
(Anderson and Tushman, 1990) can be helpful to assess the potential impacts of new 
digital technology on organizations.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Digital innovation and transformation: An institu-
tional perspective’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Third, the consequences 
of DT – such as the emergence of new digital business models even in non-digital in-
dustries – seem to extend beyond those of previous phases of IT-enabled change, which 
were usually related to the practice level and rather incremental change within firms 
 14676486, 2021, 5, Downloaded from https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/joms.12639 by Capes, Wiley Online Library on [30/04/2025].
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Implementing a digital 
strategy: Learning from the experience of three digital transformation projetcs’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
When employing the DT perspective of holistic co-evolution, theories of institutional 
design (Van de Ven and Hargrave, 2004) can be very helpful for learning how organiza-
tional actions and actors are interacting with the surrounding digital business ecosystem.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Rapid adaptation in digital transformation: 
A participatory process for engaging IS and business leaders’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘HR in the digital age: How digital technology will 
change HR’s organization structure, processes and roles’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Understanding digital transformation: A review and a research agenda’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Technological embeddedness and organizational 
change’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
However, future 
research should scrutinize necessary adaptations because collective action is no longer a 
punctual event, but a constant, never-ending process in digital business ecosystems which 
involves ever-changing groups of actors.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Digital transformation of business models – best prac-
tices, enablers, and roadmap’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Enterprise systems use: Towards a structurational analysis of enterprise 
systems induced organizational transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Similarly, 
theories of institutional adaptation (Van de Ven and Hargrave, 2004) seem promising 
for investigating how firms adapt internally to cope with new legitimacy requirements in 
a digitalizing world.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Building dynamic capabilities for digital transformation: An ongoing 
process of strategic renewal’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘How to add value to business by employing digital 
technologies and transforming management approaches’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Last, when looking at the outcomes, we identi-
fied that practically every sphere of an organization can but not necessarily has to be 
affected, illustrating that firms attempt to achieve or remain fit with the contextual con-
ditions, leading to new socio-organizational configurations (Avgerou, 2001), which may 
require incremental to fundamental adaptations depending on the context.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For example, Downes and Nunes (2013) 
describe the transformational impact of digital technologies combined with constantly 
changing customer preferences and a more competitive environment on entire organi-
zations and their actions.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
When considering this dimension, researchers 
on organizational change typically focus on intra-organizational actors and actions (e.g., 
Armenakis and Bedeian, 1999; Sminia and de Rond, 2012).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Digital transformation and value creation: Sea change ahead’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
When employing the DT perspective of compartmentalized adaptation, continuous the-
ories of interpersonal interaction and socialization (Woodman and Dewett, 2004) can 
be helpful for investigating both how established organizational actors learn new digital 
 14676486, 2021, 5, Downloaded from https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/joms.12639 by Capes, Wiley Online Library on [30/04/2025].
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
As we have discussed, 
in DT, we observe a confluence of organizational, technical and environmental factors 
(El Sawy et al., 2010), making it difficult to separate one from the other or to delineate 
clear relationships to assess the meaning of context for the development and efficacy of 
change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Organizationally relevant journeys in individual change’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
the overall shifts in organizations and business environments described above.
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
[Institutional 
design theory]
•	 How and why does embeddedness in evolving digital business 
ecosystems alter organizational cultures?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
(2017) say, in summary, that digital firms adapt rapidly though the mechanisms of 
data-driven operation (e.g., fine-grained monitoring and user profiling based on digital 
technologies), swift transformation (e.g., fast redefinition of core markets, identities and 
activities) and instant release (e.g., dynamic innovation of digital offerings based on cus-
tomer feedback).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Digital transformation: A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Thus, 
we relate our findings particularly to the distinction in organizational change literature 
between episodic and continuous change perspectives, as this distinction is ‘sufficiently 
 14676486, 2021, 5, Downloaded from https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/joms.12639 by Capes, Wiley Online Library on [30/04/2025].
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Third, managers require DT harmonizing skills with regards to organizational change 
processes.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Organizational transformation during institutional upheaval’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Managerial Implications
Next to the aforementioned implications for research, this study also provides valuable 
insights into managerial practice with respect to organizational change and strategy.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘The new organization logic of digital innovation: An 
agenda for information systems research’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
However, this perspective is quite difficult to put into practice as there is a plethora of as-
pects that could be examined, both concerning organizational design and digital business 
ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Such work thereby describes how 
conditions within digital business ecosystems interact with organizational designs as a 
whole.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘The digital workplace is key to digital innovation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
•	 How do we need to adapt our understanding of collec-
tive action to capture the specifics of turbulent digital 
business ecosystems?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, the changes and challenges brought to 
the fore by the COVID-19 pandemic illustrate the turbulent nature of digital business 
ecosystems in which organizations are embedded.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This is particularly the 
case due to the new complexity stemming from the increasing interconnectedness of 
various and dispersed actors in digital business ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In particular, 
we observe the move towards malleable organizational designs that are embedded in and 
driven by digital business ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
However, again, when we look at the outcomes of DT and the higher level of 
flexibility the malleable organizational design implies, we see change agents following the 
continuous paradigm as a new constant.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Learning & development in times of digital 
transformation: Facilitating a culture of change and innovation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Digital transformation by SME entrepreneurs: A capability 
perspective’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Designing organizational structure in the age of digitization’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Finally, DT also has effects that go beyond the direct control of organizations and 
affect the environments in which organizations are embedded and which they need to 
adapt to.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘How do chief digital officers pursue digital transformation activ-
ities?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Next, we discuss the derived thematic patterns 
and the typology in relation to established theoretical accounts in the literature on orga-
nizational change and innovation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Digital platforms as sources for organizational and strategic 
transformation: A case study of the midblue project’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Social, technical and institutional change’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, theories of collective action (Van de Ven and Hargrave, 2004) 
seem promising given the importance of digital business ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In particular, 
they may be used to investigate how new institutional building blocks, such as new soft-
ware and digital practices, become taken for granted and widely reshape organizational 
working arrangements across traditional industry boundaries (Hinings et al., 2018; Kim 
et al., 2004).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Institutional complexity and organizational change: An open polity per-
spective’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
•	 How can we extend punctuated equilibrium theory to 
account for continuous adaptive organizations in turbu-
lent digital business ecosystems that do not stabilize after 
disruptions?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
First, developing a digital transformation strategy that ‘serves as a cen-
tral concept to integrate the entire coordination, prioritization, and implementation of 
digital transformations within a firm’ (Matt et al., 2015, p. 339) is key to marshalling 
this integration in the course of DT.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Digital business strategy: Toward 
a next generation of insights’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Nevertheless, as the mechanisms of 
unlocking organizations and increasing technological flexibility indicate, a general move 
towards greater adaptability is evident.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Outcomes relating to organizational setups refer to the configuration of the constituents 
of the firm (Kanungo et al., 2001) and how organizations change in the course of DT.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Here, it seems interesting to see if strong cultures can serve as a connective 
tissue holding the dynamics of malleable organizational designs and turbulent digital 
business ecosystems together (Weick and Quinn, 1999).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Organization and Environment.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Compart-mentalized 
adaptation
•	 How can trainings help existing organizational members to 
learn new digital behaviors and utilize new digital technology?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
A key differential factor that sets digital business ecosystems 
apart is their turbulent nature (El Sawy and Perreira, 2013).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Strategizing information systems-enabled organizational transformation: A 
transdiciplinary review and new directions’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Context and action in the transformation of the firm’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In summary and as indicated by recent works (e.g., Wessel et al., 
2020), it seems that the phenomenon of DT differs from past IT-related organizational 
change and cannot, therefore, be explained entirely using established theoretical models 
(Markus and Rowe, 2018).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
When digital technologies enter organizations, they interact with organizational anteced-
ents, particularly organizational and managerial characteristics.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Digital business strategy and value creation: Framing the dynamic cycle of control 
points’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Similarly, it seems interesting to investigate 
how competition and cooperation among digital start-ups and incumbent firms relate 
to organizational structures.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Five myths about digital transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Here digital firms and non-digital firms 
diverge, as the latter have to deal with a pre-existing organizational design, requiring a 
digital transformation strategy and physical-digital harmonizing, while digital firms are 
regularly built from scratch (Tumbas et al., 2017).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This perspective 
reveals how firms react to complex changes in their environment.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For 
instance, one might explain the success of a firm in managing change associated with 
a specific technology, while concurrently observing the overall downturn of the firm or 
industry as a whole due to the widespread diffusion of digital technologies across society.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
By juxtaposing the two dimensions of contextual scope and intra-organizational change 
process based on our definitions, a two-by-two typology that delineates four distinct per-
spectives on DT emerges (see Figure 3).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘The role of dynamic capabilities in e-business transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘HR digital disruption: The biggest wave of transformation in decades’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
[Neo-institutional theory]
•	 How and why can conflicting views, both inside organiza-
tions and within digital business ecosystems, be reconciled?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Due to this nature, change becomes a constant, irrespective of the intentions of a 
participating organization.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, linking DT to extant knowledge on organizational 
change would enable us to give more informed guidance on successfully managing DT 
in business practice (Andriole, 2017), particularly regarding strategy and organizational 
change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Thus, in the course of DT, the continuous adaptation enabled by mallea-
ble organizational designs contributes to a holistic confluence of environmental turbu-
lence, IT systems and organizational capabilities.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Accordingly, this holistic confluence differs from traditional views that differentiated or-
ganizational change as triggered by technology, organizational agency or social interac-
tion (Markus and Robey, 1988).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Healthcare and digital transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Architectural 
decision management for digital transformation of products and services’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In other words, 
as the boundaries of the phenomenon are unclear, we cannot be sure whether DT is cov-
ered by existing knowledge of organizational change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘The role of dynamic capabilities in responding to digital disruption: A 
factor-based study of the newspaper industry’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For instance, heterogeneous and dispersed external software devel-
opers have been found to alter the value creation structures of focal companies (Parker 
et al., 2017), while other consequences concerning organizational change remain unex-
plored.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: On the more technical side, organizations need an increasing technological flexibility.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The metaphor of an optical lens (Van de Ven and Hargrave, 
2004), which either ‘zooms in’ and focuses on specific aspects and changes related to 
contextual conditions and outcomes of DT or ‘zooms out’ to observe the phenomenon
