in a broader context, can be used here to describe the contextual scope in relation to digital 
business ecosystems and malleable organizational designs.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For instance, in the context of healthcare, Coile (2000) describes how entering 
the information economy alters technological opportunities and consumer and provider 
demands, as well as resulting in changes to healthcare organizations’ practices and struc-
tures.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
With regard to the analytic framework characteristics (Poole, 2004), episodic change 
literature takes macro-level perspectives and sees change as punctuated by occasional 
external events, affecting internal deep structures and leading to revolutionary change in-
volving replacement to reach a new equilibrium.
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON'), ('Poole', 'PRODUCT'), ('2004', 'DATE')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Due to the specific nature of digital technologies (Kallinikos et 
al., 2013), particularly the generativity they induce inside and beyond organizations (Yoo 
et al., 2012), we contend that even episodic phases of DT trigger continuous changes.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Dynamics in organizational culture’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Digital business ecosystems define business environments ‘shaped by a net-
work of interdependencies specifically generated through digital technologies’ (Kopalle 
et al., 2020, pp.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
As a further result of their turbulent nature, digital business ecosystems also diverge 
from regular business ecosystems with regard to their constituents.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This suggests that 
the move towards a malleable organizational design can involve overcoming inertia.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In the words of El Sawy and 
Perreira (2013, p. 2), ‘[u]nlike other business environments, digital business ecosystems 
can never be expected to revert to any kind of “equilibrium” after disruptions change 
things; turbulence implies that cause-and-effect may cascade in unpredictable ways to 
alter the structure or health of the ecosystem, or end it entirely’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In a similar vein, new digitalized customer expectations or social practices, 
as an indirect effect of new technology, might lead to adaptations in business models or 
product designs across contexts (Correani et al., 2020; Warner and Wäger, 2019; Yoo, 
2010).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The contextual scope can be 
rather narrow if the focus is on the relationship between specific elements from digital 
business ecosystems and particular aspects of the organizational design.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, using the lens of culture 
change (Hatch, 2004), future research should investigate how the increasing embedded-
ness in global, cross-industry and large scale digital business ecosystems involving intense 
and ongoing interactions with heterogeneous actors (Yoo et al., 2012) leads to dynam-
ics in organizational culture.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: A Digital Technology Agenda Driving an Accelerated Transition to the New Normal.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Central issues in the study of change and innovation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
[Creative 
accumulation theory]
•	 How can we explain if and how practices of external 
actors (such as developers or consumers) alter organiza-
tional structures on the basis of shared digital technolo-
gies using technology structuration theory?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Innovation diffusion in global contexts: 
Determinants of post-adoption digital transformation of European companies’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Typology of digital transformation perspectives
 14676486, 2021, 5, Downloaded from https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/joms.12639 by Capes, Wiley Online Library on [30/04/2025].
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘The next digital transformation: From an individual-centered to an 
everyone-to-everyone economy’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In the episodic paradigm, organizations are seen as iner-
tia-prone and infrequently changing, while in the continuous paradigm they are perceived 
as constantly adapting structures (Weick and Quinn, 1999).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Change transfers and radiates across levels that can and, in the past, have often 
been viewed separately (Markus and Robey, 1988; Volkoff et al., 2007), as individuals, 
organizations and societies are concurrently affected and are connected through a nested 
hierarchy-like structure.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Power and organizational transformation through technology: Hybrids 
of electronic government’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Conversely, we identified studies 
which clearly focused on these intra-organizational innovation and integration aspects 
as drivers towards malleable organizational designs by, for example, describing strategies 
and steps on how organizations can guide their DT endeavours (e.g., Li et al., 2017).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Managerial characteristics, on the 
other hand, rely on the digital transformation awareness of  TMT to initiate DT.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This encompasses bringing together and communicating between the ‘physical’ 
and the ‘digital’ business units, recognizing areas of synergies and areas of friction, rec-
onciling differences, and paying attention to cultural aspects by balancing and blending.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Besides, resulting from the increased 
interconnectedness, local adaptations in internal as well as external practice may aggre-
gate to change beyond firm boundaries and require organizations to co-evolve with a 
dynamically changing global topography (Tanriverdi et al., 2010).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Towards Malleable Organizational Designs
From the multiple organizational facets that are subject to change within the course of 
DT, we can identify a move towards malleable organizational designs.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This is also underscored by the fact that firms are increasingly embedded in and interwo-
ven with digital business ecosystems that are inherently turbulent (El Sawy and Perreira, 
2013).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The process of change dimension refers to ‘the action, reactions, and interactions 
from the various interested parties as they seek to move the firm from its present to its 
future state’ (Pettigrew, 1987, pp.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Thus, a broader view, one that goes beyond organizational design, 
is required to expand our understanding of DT.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
To summarize, we observe a shift towards malleable organizational designs that enable 
firms to adapt continuously to their environments.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Despite this lack of  clarity surrounding the phenomenon, a common 
theme in the current debate is that due to the proliferation of  digital technologies – 
defined as the combination and connectivity of  innumerable, dispersed information, 
communication and computing technologies (Bharadwaj et al., 2013) – contemporary 
organizations are both affected and need to adapt (e.g., Correani et al., 2020; Verhoef 
et al., 2019; Weill and Woerner, 2018).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The content of this change, we find, comprises a move towards malleable or-
ganizational designs that are embedded in and driven by digital business ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Using technology and constituting structures: A practice lens for studying technol-
ogy in organizations’’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Firms support the move towards a malleable organizational design in several ways.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘How smart, connected products are transforming companies’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Business Systems Research, 2, 1–56.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Thus, it is becoming increasingly complex 
to maintain an overview of the value propositions pursued and the participants within 
digital business ecosystems, and to determine their positions and the activity flows among 
them.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Second, this approach has been applied multiple times in 
case studies in the context of DT and digital innovation (e.g., Henfridsson and Bygstad, 
2013; Huang et al., 2017).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Such work 
is important in tracing how organizations adapt to particular technologies or innova-
tions in a discrete context.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘IT-enabled business transformation: From automation to business scope redefini-
tion’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For innovative mechanisms, we find 
evidence for both structurational effects emerging from practice and technology use as 
well as fundamental change programs.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
•	 How can we adapt theories of strategic choice to ac-
count for the characteristics of digital business ecosys-
tems and the resulting consequences for managerial 
agency?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Research agenda
DT perspective
Phenomenological advancement
Theoretical advancement
Technology impact
•	 How do emerging digital technologies (e.g., distributed ledger 
technologies, virtual and augmented reality, quantum comput-
ing or AI) influence particular elements of inter- and intra-
organizational structuring?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:

metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, as key pervasive technologies become increasingly 
infrastructural and widely accessible for firms (Tilson et al., 2010), and as external actors 
become more and more central to delivering important capabilities, the interactions of 
organizations with and their embeddedness in their environments becomes increasingly 
complex and intense.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: The Journal of  Strategic Information Systems, 10, 29–57.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Managers need not only to observe and react to changes, but also to be aware of the 
quantity and variety of data, as well as of emerging digital technologies and their prop-
erties.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Our findings also suggest that contemporary firms undertake a general 
move to configure their organizations so as to enable and support such mechanisms.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

identification?

text:
[Complex adaptive systems theory]
•	 Can we adapt contingency theories to account for the 
holistic confluence of technological, environmental and 
organizational factors in DT?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
[Population and community ecology 
theory]
•	 How do digital entrants enter competition and/or cooperation 
with established firms and which effects result for the latter?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: The Journal of  Strategic Information Systems, 18, 46–55.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Conversely, the contextual scope can 
be rather broad if the holistic confluence of multiple technological, organizational and 
environmental elements in digital business ecosystems, as well as their interactions with 
organizational design as a whole, is considered.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Neo-institutional per-
spectives (Greenwood and Hinings, 1996), combining continuous and episodic elements, 
can be of particular value for investigating such co-evolution of organizations and their 
digitalized environments.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
To provide an example along the multi-dimensional framework: while 
we see new technologies constantly emerging in large varieties, change is also driven 
substantially by interactions with customers gradually evolving digitalized expectations 
as an important part of the contextual conditions.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Traditionally, scholars in the field 
of organizational change distinguished between inner contexts (i.e., structures, corporate 
cultures and political context within firms) and outer contexts (i.e., the social, economic, 
political and competitive environment of a firm) (Pettigrew, 1987).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Such studies also describe indirect tech-
nology impacts, which are expressed through changing digital customer demands or new 
regulations and standards that result from the diffusion of new digital technologies.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Information Systems Research, 21, 748–59.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘How legacy firms can embrace the digital ecosystem 
via digital customer orientation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In a similar 
vein, one might ask if theories relating to organizational learning (Vera et al., 2011) need 
to be adapted to the new realities of DT, where learning is more and more data-driven, 
potentially automatized and tuned to the external environment.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Configurational approaches to organizational analysis’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
By connect-
ing these content patterns with the dimensions of context and process (Pettigrew, 1987), 
we derived four perspectives on DT: technology impact, compartmentalized adaptation, 
systemic shift and holistic co-evolution.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The malleable organizational designs that are brought 
about by DT build on digital technologies and agile structures to adapt rapidly to en-
vironmental opportunities and threats.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
See the Terms and Conditions (https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/terms-and-conditions) on Wiley Online Library for rules of use; OA articles are governed by the applicable Creative Commons License
	
A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation	
1197
© 2020 The Authors.
entities: [('Wiley Online Library', 'ORG'), ('OA', 'GPE'), ('Creative Commons License\n\t\nA Systematic Review', 'ORG'), ('Digital Transformation', 'ORG'), ('1197', 'DATE'), ('2020', 'DATE')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Here, we can learn, for instance, 
how organizations evolve in response to particular triggers towards data-driven opera-
tions and decision-making.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Through this boundary clarification, an agenda for future research as well 
as important managerial implications for strategy and organizational change arise.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Growing on steroids: Rapidly scaling the user 
base of digital ventures through digital innovation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Similarly, DT drives 
digital-permeated markets, economies and societies as information and communication technol-
ogies increasingly mediate interactions among consumers, within firms, and between 
firms and their customers (e.g., Tilson et al., 2010).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Information Systems Research, 21, 724–35.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Organizing for innovation in the digitized 
world’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
However, in the 
course of DT, we contend that through the holistic confluence comprising material, or-
ganizational and further environmental dimensions (El Sawy et al., 2010), so-called digital 
business ecosystems, which in the past were only a topic of interest for IT and software 
industries, are becoming more and more inseparable from regular business ecosystems 
and increasingly relevant across sectors as digital technologies diffuse through industries 
and society.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Impact of e-book technology: Ownership and market asymmetries in 
digital transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
realm (Poole, 2004; Weick and Quinn, 1999) might be utilized with regard to each of the 
four DT perspectives.
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON'), ('2004', 'DATE'), ('Weick', 'GPE'), ('Quinn', 'GPE'), ('1999', 'DATE'), ('four', 'CARDINAL'), ('DT', 'ORG')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Clearly, the emergence and diffusion of a variety of digital technologies and applications have 
triggered and shaped DT as material antecedents.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Context and action in the transformation of the firm: A reprise’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
2017) especially shape DT due to their specific characteristics, referred to as digital proper-
ties, most importantly their reprogrammability, homogenization of data, and self-referen-
tial nature (Yoo, 2010).
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON'), ('Yoo', 'PERSON'), ('2010', 'DATE')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
As a result, build-
ing on prior knowledge on organizational change to better understand the phenomenon 
and give informed advice to practice is problematic.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Is your company ready for a digital future’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Finally, DT in organizations culminates in the outcome of automatized, 
data-driven and virtual business processes through an enhanced use of digital technologies and 
software for performing tasks (e.g., Dery et al., 2017), as well as the development of smart, 
connected and customized products (e.g., Porter and Heppelman, 2015).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Shared value innovation: Linking competitiveness and societal goals in the context 
of digital transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, a 
large part of the technological set up may lie outside the control of a particular firm 
and may evolve unpredictably, at the will of external actors, such as tech giants or digital 
 14676486, 2021, 5, Downloaded from https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/joms.12639 by Capes, Wiley Online Library on [30/04/2025].
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
behaviours in a particular setting (such as doctors interacting with robots) and how new 
actors such as hired digital talent might resist socialization and bring forth change in 
incumbent firms.
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
First, as is explained in more detail later on, it allowed us to cater to all 
four of the dimensions of organizational change, or ‘issues common to all change efforts’ 
(p. 293), named by Armenakis and Bedeian (1999), i.e., content, context, process and out-
comes (see explanation below).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Key themes of change in work design and leadership’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
However, the systemic shift perspective does 
not describe how organizations achieve adaptations to and interactions with their respec-
tive business environments.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘The unfolding of value sources during online business 
model transformation’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Information Systems Research, 21, 443–71.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Competing by Design: The Power of  Organizational Culture.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In addition, management 
styles change towards technology-focused and -supported management.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

Finally, we found that firms need to 
account for the digitalization of  the individual.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

content providers in the social age’.

text:
Again, as can be seen in the innovation mechanisms, no matter how incremental 
or fundamental the respective change is, we can diagnose a higher importance of digital 
 14676486, 2021, 5, Downloaded from https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/joms.12639 by Capes, Wiley Online Library on [30/04/2025].
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Mobilization for and acceleration of  digital transformation by TMTs 
is another critical activity at the strategic level, and is used, among other things, to attract 
a new generation of workers (e.g., Matzler et al., 2018) and to establish digital mindsets 
(e.g., Hansen et al., 2011).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
[Institutional diffusion theory]
•	 What are the different pathways that new digital technologies 
(such as virtual or augmented reality) take in terms of comple-
menting and substituting established competences?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
[Population and 
community ecology theory]
•	 How do behaviors of dispersed actors, connected through 
shared digital technologies, radiate throughout ecosystems and 
organizations?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In the 
category mechanisms we identified, for example, process models to describe and explain 
how small and medium enterprises drive DT in their companies (Li et al., 2017).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Information Systems Research, 18, 125–41.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This shift continues in the in-
tra-organizational structuring: organizations develop permeable, agile organizational structures, 
and in doing so become agile, adaptable and boundaryless, as manifested in organiza-
tional forms such as Holacracy (e.g., Schwer and Hitz, 2018).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Accordingly, we differentiate between 
organizational setups, economics and spill-overs.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

‘Research commentary – Reframing the dominant 
quests of information systems strategy research for complex adaptive business systems’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The idea of continuously adaptable 
organizations is not new (e.g., Weick and Quinn, 1999).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
(2016) describe how banks are transforming their culture and 
leadership styles while building agile and scalable digital infrastructures.

enable managers to integrate new digital products and processes within the existing orga-

text:
•	 How do DT-induced changes in the organizational setup influ-
ence firm performance?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Organizational 
designs manifest key tenets of a firm’s organization activities and can be described as 
‘configuration[s] of the formal organizational arrangements, including the formal struc-
tures, processes, and systems that make up an organization’ (Nadler and Tushman, 1997, 
p. 48).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
As revealed by the innovation mech-
anisms in our framework, firms are incorporating more and more digital technologies 
into their operational capabilities.

‘Understanding strategic change: The contribution of arche-
types’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For instance, by engaging in digital innovation, 
new digital business models are established that allow for instant release.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This 
content of change can be viewed from four different perspectives, including a technology 
impact, compartmentalized adaptation, systemic shift and holistic co-evolution perspective.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
The search within the BSC database was performed using the 
following keywords: ‘digital transformation’ and ‘digital’ AND ‘transformation’.

text:
Swift transformation requires firms to alter 
their positioning and capabilities according to new, dynamically emerging and dissolving 
opportunities.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For instance, Henfridsson and Yoo (2013) used it to describe 
trajectory shifts of automotive incumbents entering the era of digital innovation.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For instance, developing a digital business strategy is a key activity linked 
to strategy.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: The role of organization design parameters’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This dynamic 
is also evident in our findings: in the contextual conditions part of our multi-dimensional 
framework (see Figure 2) we still identify established structures and processes as well as 
path dependency as antecedents; in the integration mechanisms part we see already a 
high importance of technical as well as organizational adaptability.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘The business model: Recent developments and future research’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
From these two patterns, we derive four perspectives on 
the phenomenon of DT: technology impact, compartmentalized adaptation, systemic shift and 
holistic co-evolution.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This comes alongside a surge of published articles, conference panels and

metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
A malleable organizational design can be understood as one that is easily influ-
enced and can be easily changed.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
First, we provide 
the most comprehensive and up-to-date review of DT from a management perspective, 
synthesizing and integrating the current state of knowledge into a comprehensive and 
connective framework, and deriving two thematic patterns that describe the overarching 
peculiarities of DT.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Our review 
found material, organizational and environmental antecedents which trigger and shape DT 
(see Wessel et al., 2020).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of Management Studies published by Society for the Advancement of Management 
Studies and John Wiley & Sons Ltd
et al.
entities: [('Journal of Management Studies', 'ORG'), ('Society for the Advancement of Management \nStudies', 'ORG'), ('John Wiley & Sons Ltd', 'PERSON')]
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Here, managers need to develop specific mindfulness, i.e., a perception about what to 
keep and what to change in the course of DT, which depends on the general opportu-
nities and risks but is also contextualized to the specific industry, as we determined in 
the nature of change.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

(Eds), Handbook of

text:
In the outcomes category, we can see, among other things, a 
shift towards connected markets in which the participants are involved in numerous ex-
change networks that are easily formed, grown, and dissolved again.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
For innovation mechanisms, we found that DT involves novelty in both strategic and 
operational regards.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Such studies describe direct technol-
ogy impacts, typically focusing on a particular technology or system and describing its 
peculiarities and specific implications for organizations.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This involves both the creation of completely new business 
models (e.g., Dutra et al., 2018) and the modification of existing business models (e.g., 
Berman, 2012).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

‘Information technologies in business: A blueprint for education and 
research’.

text:
How do existing cul-
tures and the move towards malleable organizational designs 
interact?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Click and mortar: Organizations on the web’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
They also illustrate the benefits of new 
ecosystem-oriented collaboration models, for example through establishing digital plat-
forms and joining new or existing ecosystems to deliver innovative digital products and 
services and to meet surging online-order demand (McKinsey, 2020; strategy&, 2020).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Our findings 
emphasize the relevance of these factors, and thus a general move towards digital busi-
ness ecosystems.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: Strategic Management Journal, 18, 509–33.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: The organizational setup category of our findings indicates such a conclusion.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Second, the integration 
mechanisms of our framework show that firms fuse this new knowledge and capabilities 
with what already exists in their organization.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Journal of  the 
Association for Information Systems, in press.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘The generative mechanisms of digital infrastructure evolution’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Furthermore, we 
observed the convergence of previously separate industries as heterogeneous actors from 
different industries increasingly operate and compete within the same markets due to the 
affordances of digital technologies, which bring together previously disconnected user 
experiences (for example broadband Internet, phone and TV services) (Yoo et al., 2012).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Technological discontinuities and dominant designs: A cyclical 
model of technological change’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
We can witness this phenomenon for example in the 
current COVID-19 pandemic that simultaneously highlights the potential as well as the 
necessity of malleable organizational designs: regulatory measures to contain the spread 
of the virus such as lockdowns and limited person-to-person contacts are forcing new 
digital ways of collaboration (e.g., through tools such as Zoom or Slack), service delivery 
models (e.g., through the adoption of AI and robotic process automation), and customer 
relationship management (e.g., through harnessing digital channels) (KMPG, 2020; 
McKinsey, 2020; strategy&, 2020).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘Dynamic capabilities and strategic management’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text: ‘The effects of information technology on strategic decision making’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Therefore, knowledge yielded by studies following this perspective must be 
complemented by insights into how the forces they focus on – such as new technologies 
– might be intertwined with other aspects, such as customer or employee behaviour, and 
how they together might trigger and shape DT.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

•	 How does DT relate to the distinction of theories of 
change vs. theories of changing?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

age: Assumptions, conjectures and suggestions’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Future research might investigate whether DT leads to the seemingly 
contradictory result that firms adapt faster than ever on the basis of flexible ordinary 
capabilities, while the need for dynamic capabilities in the traditional sense shrinks.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
In this process, 
they continuously navigate a dynamic digital landscape in which digital technologies 
such as smartphones emerge, are rapidly adopted, and thus lead to considerable changes 
in customer behaviour and expectations.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘Research commentary – Seeking the config-
urations of digital ecodynamics: It takes three to tango’.

text:
[Population and community ecology theory]
•	 Over time, can we observe more homogeneity in organiza-
tional forms through the interactions of initially heterogeneous 
players within digital business ecosystems?
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
Finally, concerning the change agent, episodic change assumes a change agent that needs 
to radically alter mind-sets within the organization to create change (Weick and Quinn, 
1999).

Journal, 39, 2255–76.

metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
With a more operational focus but embedded in the strategic 
orientation, the exploitation and leveraging of  digital capabilities is important for organizations, 
mainly regarding online informational capabilities (Barua et al., 2004), big data analyt-
ics capabilities (e.g., Hausladen and Zipf, 2018) and digital platform capabilities (e.g., 
Karimi and Walter, 2015).
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

Garud, R., Kumaraswamy, A., Roberts, A. and Xu, L. (2020).

metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
While there are multiple frameworks that differentiate orga-
nizational change in this way, our findings reveal a special connection to the distinction 
between episodic and continuous change (Weick and Quinn, 1999), most notably be-
cause the dynamics of change denotes a common theme in both the aforementioned the-
matic patterns.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
‘A framework for integrating organizational learning, knowl-
edge, capabilities, and absorptive capacity’.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
As for the particular dynamic nature of these digital 
operational capabilities (Kallinikos et al., 2013), the difference between ordinary and 
dynamic capabilities might vanish, as capabilities based on digital technology are very 
easily adaptable.
metadata: title: A Systematic Review of the Literature on Digital Transformation: Insights and Implications for Strategy and Organizational Change; creationDate: D:20220128162049+05'30'; modDate: D:20250430211400-07'00'; subject: J Management Studies 2021.58:1159-1197

text:
This shift can be triggered and occasionally punctuated by episodic bursts when 
the malleability of the organizational design does not allow to react to organizational, 
material or social variations (Weick and Quinn, 1999).

text:
Introduction
In recent years, digital transformation (DT) has emerged as an important phenomenon in strategic IS research (Bharadwaj et al.,
2013; Piccinini et al., 2015a) as well as for practitioners (Fitzgerald et al., 2014; Westerman et al., 2011).

text:
Digital transformation: a research agenda
Our review highlights the signiﬁcant contributions that research has made toward our understanding of DT.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text:
At the organizational level, it has been argued that ﬁrms must ﬁnd ways to innovate with these
technologies by devising “strategies that embrace the implications of digital transformation and drive better operational perfor-
mance” (Hess et al., 2016:123).
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text:
Digital technologies can help ﬁrms rapidly adapt to changes in environmental conditions (Fitzgerald,
2016b; Günther et al., 2017; Hong and Lee, 2017; Huang et al., 2017; Kohli and Johnson, 2011) by contributing to organizational
agility, deﬁned as a ﬁrm’s “ability to detect opportunities for innovation and seize those competitive market opportunities by
G. Vial

125
Table 5
Transforming value creation and capture processes.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text:
Avenue 1: How dynamic capabilities contribute to digital transformation
Our review and our inductive framework highlight the nature of DT as a process where digital technologies create an impetus for
organizations to implement responses to gain or maintain their competitive advantage.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text:
The present work therefore proposes to take stock of current
knowledge on the topic by studying the research question: “What do we know about digital transformation?”
Consistent with the breadth of our research question, we adopt an inductive approach using techniques borrowed from grounded
theory (Wolfswinkel et al., 2013) and review 282 works on DT culled from IS literature.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text:
Conclusion
Our review of IS research on the digital transformation phenomenon highlights a rich body of literature that contributes to our
understanding of the beneﬁts as well as the challenges associated with digital transformation at multiple levels.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text:
Digital transformation is concerned with the changes digital
technologies can bring about in a company’s business model, which
result in changed products or organizational structures or in the
automation of processes.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text:
Digital transformation is the profound and accelerating transformation
of business activities, processes, competencies, and models to fully
leverage the changes and opportunities brought by digital
technologies and their impact across society in a strategic and
prioritized way.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text:
Changes and transformations that are driven and built on a foundation
of digital technologies.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text:
Digital transformation highlights the impact of IT on organizational
structure, routines, information ﬂow, and organizational
capabilities to accommodate and adapt to IT.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;

text: How chief digital oﬃcers promote the digital transformation of their companies.
metadata: title: Understanding digital transformation_ A review and a research agenda; author: Gregory Vial; creationDate: D:20190607103227Z; modDate: D:20190607103227Z; subject: Journal of Strategic Information Systems, 28 (2019) 118-144. doi:10.1016/j.jsis.2019.01.003; keywords: Digital transformation; IS strategy; Literature review; Digital technologies; Organizational transformation; Digital innovation;
