When all products are 
digital: Complexity and intangible value in the ecosystem of digitizing firms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital transformation: Five 
recommendations for the digitally conscious firm.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The 
digitalization of operations and supply chain management: Theoretical and 
methodological implications.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digitalization and the greening of supply 
chains.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
In 
digital ecosystems, firms tend to replace such linear processes with 
distributed and interconnected forms of production, in which activities 
occur concurrently (Bürger et al., 2019; Srai et al., 2016).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text: Competing in digital ecosystems.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Introduction 
When firms use digital technologies to create new or modify existing 
business models and processes or to support the transformation of 
organizational structures, resources, or relationships with internal and 
external actors, scholars refer to this as digital transformation (DT) 
(Brynjolfsson & Hitt, 2000; Frank et al., 2019; Loebbecke & Picot, 2015; 
Vial, 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital transformation and organization design: 
An integrated approach.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Emerging from the discussion of the reviewed literature, we propose a 
set of promising future research avenues for DT on organizational power 
and emerging forms of organization in the digital economy.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Revamping your business through digital 
transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Supply chain 
digitalization: Past, present and future.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Our analysis demonstrates how firms are being transformed from 
stand-alone entities into part of digital ecosystems, thereby contributing 
to the theory of the firm in the digital age.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text: Mastering the digital transformation of sales.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The digital transformation of 
traditional businesses.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The notion of “distributed 
manufacturing” is one of the prominent findings from the DT literature.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
To enable the effective adoption and use of digital technologies, 
firms alter their organizational structures by establishing innovation 
labs, corporate innovation centers, and so-called Digital Business Units 
that have higher autonomy and designated budgets to catalyze organi­
zational practices and technological know-how (Salvi et al., 2021; Seran 
& Bez, 2021; Wiesbock & Hess, 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Firms are shifting from the exclusive use of digital assets that they 
fully control to the use of a variety of digital solutions developed 
internally and externally or co-designed with external partners (Gregory 
et al., 2018).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
When triple-A supply chains meet digitalization: The 
case of JD.com’s C2M model.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Finally, we understand DT of the external environment 
as changes induced by digital technologies concerning interactions be­
tween the firm and external partners, suppliers, intermediaries, and 
customers, and the resulting outcomes, e.g., competition and the 
emergence of digital ecosystems.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital ecosystems exist in technology-intensive industries and 
markets.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The membership of a digital ecosystem not only affects governance 
and organizational structures (as described above), but also tangibly 
impacts a firm’s production system.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital 
servitization business models in ecosystems: A theory of the firm.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
To summarize, the arena in which digital business model innovations 
are developed broadens from single firms into interconnected digital 
ecosystems of many firms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Dis­
solving organizational boundaries that, in turn, lead to the emergence of 
digital ecosystems challenges this notion.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
This flexibility allows 
firms with advanced digital capabilities to expand across industries, 
ultimately broadening competition and dismantling differences among 
industrial sectors.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Options for formulating a digital 
transformation strategy.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital transformation changes how companies 
create value.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Consistently, we address DT of 
the organizational periphery as changes in how the firm creates this value 
at the micro-level through improvements to products and processes via 
digital technology.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
In the digital economy, the literature argues that stand-alone firms 
and their business models are becoming progressively more connected 
through ownership rights, increasing exchange of data, and technolog­
ical infrastructure (Kauffman et al., 2010; Sommarberg & M¨akinen, 
2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital technologies contribute to power and resource shifts within 
and beyond firm organizational boundaries.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital ecosystems 
The literature on external actors emphasizes that DT leads to the 
emergence of so-called digital ecosystems, which are distinct from dig­
ital platforms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Being 
lean: How to shape digital transformation in the manufacturing sector.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Organizational processes 
Digital technologies and the growing availability of data create the 
need to adjust processes, particularly when digital innovations are broad 
and affect various business lines (Warner & W¨ager, 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The emergence of digital ecosystems that often tran­
scend traditional industry structures has accelerated this trend (Koh­
tam¨aki et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Simultaneously, the firm’s increasing inter­
connectivity is contributing to the emergence of digital platform eco­
systems that create new value sources and redefine terms that 
traditionally were viewed as lying within singular firms’ control, such as 
competitive advantage and resource management (Jacobides et al., 
2018; Kretschmer et al., 2020; McIntyre et al., 2020; Volberda et al., 
2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Effect of digital transformation on organisational 
performance of SMEs.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Future research needs to investigate 
the phenomenon of organizational powers in the digital economy.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The 
distributed model of production can help realize digital technologies’ 
sustainability potential by creating favorable conditions for the devel­
opment of resource-efficient and sustainable manufacturing (Kumar 
et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital solutions’ functionality and value tend 
to be determined by a network of co-creators, rather than by a single 
firm (Kohtam¨aki et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital servitization is the business trans­
formation of manufacturing firms toward value creation based on 
increasing digital service offerings designed atop physical products 
(Cenamor et al., 2017; Coreynen et al., 2017; Sj¨odin et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Building dynamic capabilities for digital 
transformation: An ongoing process of strategic renewal.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:

nizational hierarchies, and relationships with partners, suppliers, and 
customers (Autio et al., 2018; Beverungen et al., 2019; Kretschmer et al., 
2022; Majumder et al., 2022; Warner & W¨ager, 2019; Yoo et al., 2010).

less often within firm boundaries and more often outside them through 
interactions with partners, suppliers, customers, and online commu­
nities.

metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
However, the proliferation of digital technologies creates conditions for 
business units to develop unique capabilities and skills to gather and 
analyze data and execute tasks autonomously (Horv´ath & Szab´o, 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digitalization refers to 
“the manifold sociotechnical phenomena and processes of adopting and 
using [digital] technologies in broader individual, organizational, and 
societal contexts” (Legner et al., 2017, p. 301).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The literature indicates that the proliferation of digital technologies 
is likely to cause power and resource centralization, putting various 
business units under tighter control by corporate headquarters.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital transformation of business 
models-best practice, enablers, and roadmap.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
One of the defining features 
of digital ecosystems is that, in addition to formal and relational 
governance mechanisms, they are also governed by technological sys­
tems.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:

information, and the decentralization of the firm.

text:

challenges of small and medium-sized enterprise digitalization.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Can traditional organizations be digitally 
transformed by themselves?
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Traditionally viewed as very distinctive categories, 
firms and markets indicate a tendency toward gradually merging in a 
digital economy.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:

digitization and supply chain interdependency.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital transformation and 
customer value creation in made in Italy SMEs: A dynamic capabilities perspective.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
A systematic review of the 
literature on digital transformation: Insights and implications for strategy and 
organizational change.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
By creating markets and infrastructures for information and resource 
exchange, digital platform owners can collect rents based on the eco­
nomic activities that they mediate (Sadowski, 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Thus, the literature in­
dicates that governance structures can be both enablers and inhibitors of 
value creation in the digital economy.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Given the complexity of digital ecosystems and the 
involvement of multiple stakeholders, firms need to develop new 
managerial approaches based on orchestration and self-governance that 
create the right sets of incentives and foster relationships among 
ecosystem members (Baraldi & Nadin, 2006; Das & Dey, 2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
However, not only newly digitalized entrants 
can disrupt supply chains: DT can redefine existing supply chains 
(Nambisan & Luo, 2021; Oliveira et al., 2021): Technologically superior 
firms attain high negotiation powers in supply chains and can claim 
disproportionate value shares, while technologically inferior firms must 
comply to maintain access to value chains (Mosch et al., 2021; Son et al., 
2021).
entities: [('Nambisan & Luo', 'ORG'), ('2021', 'DATE'), ('Oliveira et al.', 'PERSON'), ('2021', 'DATE'), ('Mosch et al.', 'ORG'), ('2021', 'DATE'), ('Son et al.', 'PERSON'), ('2021', 'DATE')]
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
For 
instance, digitalization of car components shifts strategic resources from 
car manufacturers to software firms (Rahmati et al., 2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The literature describes digital platforms as multisided market 
structures that can have direct or indirect network effects (Cennamo, 
2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The develop­
ment of digital ecosystems and platforms creates network effects, mak­
ing it difficult for competitors to appropriate value.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:

systematic literature review.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital innovation and institutional 
entrepreneurship: Chief Digital Officer perspectives of their emerging role.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
DT re­
quires simultaneous emphasis on autonomy among business units while 
ensuring a required level of centralized control of a firm’s digitalization 
approach.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text: Five myths about digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Yet, despite the importance of this topic, academic research 
still lacks an informed understanding of how advancements in digital 
technologies contribute to organizational redesign and changes in the 
nature of the firm (Menz et al., 2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Applying the core-periphery concept to the DT realm, we understand 
DT of the organizational core as changes in how the firm intends to cap­
ture value and accommodate technologies in organizational structures 
and culture through digital technology.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

platforms.

text:
Digital ecosystems include a broad 
range of co-creators, extending from traditional participants (i.e., cus­
tomers and suppliers) to online communities (Magistretti et al., 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

A systematic review of the literature on digitalization in accounting.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:

servitization: A service ecosystem perspective.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
To 
better understand the emergence of digital ecosystems and their func­
tioning principles, academic research needs to develop theories to 
examine organizational power from the point of resource control, 
power’s cognitive and behavioral effects, and effects from technological 
affordances on power distribution with value co-creators’ ecosystems.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
An adaptive culture focused on a digital 
discovery process, rather than on planning and control (Alos-Simo et al., 
2017; Tronvoll et al., 2020), can enable firms to develop capabilities for 
constant learning and openness to external knowledge and expertise 
(Rothmann & Koch, 2014; Siachou et al., 2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Maintenance in digitalised 
manufacturing: Delphi-based scenarios for 2030. International Journal of Production 
Economics, 191, 154–169.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
In 
line with the more distributed nature of value creation and digital 
innovation as an increasingly collective effort, firms are advised to adopt 
hyper-adaptive organizational forms that simply cannot be governed 
solely top-down to adapt to external opportunities and threats fast 
enough (Hanelt et al., 2021; Volberda et al., 2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:

logics of business process management.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Several sources have concluded that by 
enabling automation, designing intelligent solutions, and facilitating 
direct communication between producers and customers, DT has the 
potential to increase business operations’ sustainability significantly 
(Dalenogare et al., 2018; Mishra et al., 2007; Sklyar et al., 2019; Ven­
drell-Herrero et al., 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Thus, the literature indicates that 
governance structures can be both enablers and inhibitors of value 
creation in the digital economy.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Specifically, and in addition to product and service innovations, DT 
enables novel forms of organization of manufacturing processes.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Managing technological change in 
the digital age: The role of architectural frames.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Aside from this challenge, firms 
need to strengthen their interoperability with external solutions and 
foster data-sharing opportunities, e.g., on digital platforms (Srai et al., 
2016; Tronvoll et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
However, the literature differs in its discussion on how this can be 
achieved, given that DT affects sustainability through five pathways: (1) 
immediate operational efficiency; (2) product and service innovations; 
(3) distributed manufacturing; (4) sharing economy; (5) and alignment 
of stakeholders.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital servitization 
DT creates opportunities for evolution from stand-alone products 
and services to integrated systems in which products, services, and 
software interact (Kohtam¨aki et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Due to these changes’ 
self-reinforcing nature, digitalized market incumbents’ competitive po­
sitions in a digital economy will be difficult to contest, given discrimi­
natory access to data and accumulated expertise in digital technologies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:

competencies across organizational layers and the external environment 
can cause subsequent power shifts that reshape internal structures and 
firm boundaries.

Scholars have studied how new organizational forms are conceptu­
alized under different terms, e.g., extended enterprises or meta- 
organizations (Aron & Singh, 2005; Gulati et al., 2012).

understanding how deep adoption of digital technologies redefines firms 
from the inside.

ticles).

text:
This resonates with prior findings 
(Benkler, 2017; Gulati et al., 2012; Puranam et al., 2014) on the positive 
effects from peer production and open innovation (e.g., crowdsourcing, 
user innovations, and open-source software) on the emergence of new 
forms of economic activities and the decrease in transaction costs 
through decentralized digital channels.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Due to the proliferation of platforms and digital ecosystems, firms 
are now in rivalries with networks of firms rather than with stand-alone 
firms (Cenamor et al., 2017; Nuccio & Guerzoni, 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Regardless of whether the changes induced by DT happen bottom up 
or top down, the literature suggests that firms eventually will evolve into 
interconnected networks of collaborative relationships and decentral­
ized communication channels that do not abide by the rules of a tradi­
tional vertical hierarchy (Rodriguez-Lluesma et al., 2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Distributed manufacturing’s contribution to sustainability 
is realized through shorter lead times; an emphasis on production to 
order, rather than make-to-stock; and a modular production process 
(Srai et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Specifically, firms need to manage old 
and new technological infrastructures and operations simultaneously to 
enable an uninterrupted transition toward new technological solutions; 
they also need to replace legacy systems and analog processes gradually 
while avoiding customer downtime and business disruptions (Cenamor 
et al., 2019; Park et al., 2020).

text:
We applied the following search terms in our search among titles, 
abstracts, and keywords: “digital transformation,” or “digitalisation”/ 
“digitalization,” or “digitisation”/“digitization.” We recognize that the 
closely related concepts of digitalization and digitization often are used 
interchangeably with DT in the literature (Karimi & Walter, 2016; 
Nambisan et al., 2017; Trantopoulos et al., 2017).

ture, real estate, and mining) fall behind in the adoption and use of 
digital technologies (Calvino et al., 2018).

this paper is to provide a multilayered organizational view of DT

One interesting discussion based on our analysis focuses on digital 
changes in the relationship between the organizational core and pe­
riphery.

Thus, DT creates conditions for the emergence of decen­
tralized networks in which competencies for value creation are 
distributed across a network of autonomous actors.

requires openness to external knowledge and simultaneous efforts to­
ward internal knowledge production (Cozzolino et al., 2018; Di Vaio 
et al., 2021).

In a digital economy, relationships between customers and firms are 
undergoing major changes.

text:
Going beyond the matching of 
supply and demand, digital platforms actively foster price regimes 
(Grabher & Van Tuijl, 2020).

text:
The fluidity of digital innovation processes allows innovation 
activities to evolve non-linearly, concurrently, and with frequent itera­
tions and feedback loops (Kohli & Melville, 2019; Nambisan et al., 
2017).

text:
Van Alstyne and Parker (2021) referred to this emerging value 
creation model as “inverted firms.” As a consequence, business models, 
organizational structures, and culture—all central features of the orga­
nizational core—are becoming more outward oriented and dependent 
on external actors.

text:
DT 
can lead to winner-take-all dynamics that solidify advanced technology 
users’ competitive advantages and broaden the technology diffusion gap 
with laggard firms (Langley et al., 2021; Li, 2020).

lowed the tradition in organizational and innovation research of 
conceptualizing the firm as a hierarchical organization with discrete

Gulati & Kletter, 2005; Wu et al., 2019).

dematerialization 
of 
physical 
resources 
and 
a 
shift 
toward 
software-centric services, which the literature refers to as digital servi­
tization (Sklyar et al., 2019).

text:
Digital platform ecosystems decrease information asymmetries and 
enable new interactions that previously were not possible due to the lack 
of information exchange channels among diverse stakeholders (Duch-­
Brown & Rossetti, 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The objective is to prolong physical products’ life 
cycles to enable long-term subscriptions to services, thereby making 
digital servitization a high-potential driver toward sustainability (Ven­
drell-Herrero et al., 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
DT can be defined as “strategic 
transformations targeting organizational changes implemented through digi­
talization projects, with the goal of enabling major business improvements” 
(Caputo et al., 2021, p. 490).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
In short, the manifold changes in firm structures and boundaries 
induced by DT result in a transition from stand-alone firms to ecosystems 
of value co-creators.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Therefore, our guiding research question is as follows: How does DT 
affect different organizational layers of the firm?
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

roles of platform ecosystems and industry 4.0.

innovation in the electronic economy: Insights from marshall industries.

text:
Generally, the 
proliferation of digital technologies is contributing to more information 
symmetries and transparency in marketplaces, thereby diminishing in­
cumbents’ competitive advantages and empowering new entrants 
(Hinings et al., 2018).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Digital servitization broadens access to customer data and enables 
mass customization and individualization (Bürger et al., 2019; Seyed­
ghorban, Tahernejad, et al., 2020; Weking et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Firms tend to abandon linear processes and replace them with 
distributed and interconnected forms of production, in which activities 
occur concurrently (Bürger et al., 2019; Kusiak, 2021; Srai et al., 2016).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
With such loyalty-enhancing practices, firms can gain 
continuous access to customer data and simultaneously retain sub­
scribers to digital solutions (Crittenden et al., 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
DT’s roots can be traced back to the 1980s and early 1990s, when 
researchers examined the effects of adopting information technology 
(IT) on organizational structures and hierarchies, and on innovation and 
performance (Bloomfield & Coombs, 1992; Drucker, 1988; Johnston & 
Vitale, 1988; Robey, 1981).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Studies have found that auton­
omous business units established to explore digital opportunities enable 
fast learning and experimentation, while mitigating conflicts related to 
cannibalization of business models (Smith & Beretta, 2021; Verhoef 
et al., 2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The development of digital services does not immediately lead to 
productivity gains, but may result in decreased performance, a phe­
nomenon often referred to as the servitization paradox (Kamalaldin 
et al., 2020; Kohtam¨aki et al., 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Methodology 
We deductively approached the DT literature with our three-layered 
framework of the firm and, within these layers, inductively derived 
themes from articles related to firms’ DT.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The role of digital innovation 
in knowledge management systems: A systematic literature review.

text:
Thus, the increasing modularization of products and fragmen­
tation of supply chains via DT changes the very nature of relations with 
external partners (Butollo, 2021; Nambisan & Luo, 2021).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
This 
trend indicates a departure from stand-alone firms to networks of firms 
that share resources and operate a distributed model of value co- 
creation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Existing DT literature reviews underlined the significance of orga­
nizational changes and restructuring under the impact of technological 
progress.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Thus, in a digital 
economy, the building blocks of competitive advantages increasingly 
are linked to intangible subjective perceptions.

text:
The 
aforementioned notion of network emergence and the simultaneous 
flattening of the internal hierarchy stood out during our analysis as a 
succinct multilevel connection point between the themes of organiza­
tional structure and digital ecosystems.

text:
This development ultimately would lead to 
value chains and ecosystems that are steered autonomously via self- 
organization.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The latest research on digital platforms 
demonstrates that by using different platforms simultaneously, users 
create connections and interdependencies among multiple actors, 
thereby creating ecologies of platforms (Grabher & Van Tuijl, 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Organizational power 
The inherent conflict between the concentration and distribution of 
power within the firm induced by DT leads to promising avenues for 
future research.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

Technology Management, 33(1), 41–60.

text:
Ghobakhloo 
(2020) describes interoperability as digital infrastructures’ ability to 
interact, exchange data, and jointly operate with each other freely.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
However, Govindarajan 
and Immelt (2019) emphasized that not only creativity, but also disci­
pline and integrity, are crucial components of digital culture, as they 
enable capturing digital technologies’ potential for value creation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
DT 
poses considerable strategic management challenges both for academics 
and business practitioners.

text: Computer information systems and organization structure.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Shorter information flows, increased interconnectivity of heterogeneous 
stakeholders, and increased analytical capabilities enable firms to be 
more proactive and agile in their responses to supply chain changes (De 
Giovanni, 2021; Grover & Ramanlal, 2004; Gupta et al., 2020; Mak & 
Shen, 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
To address power shifts that result from organizational restructuring 
and DT, firms need to find a balance between reinforcing the clarity of 
governance structures and allowing reconfigurations that foster flexi­
bility and responsiveness (Sj¨odin et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
How environmental 
innovations emerge and proliferate in supply networks: A complex adaptive systems 
perspective.

text:
These techno­
logical shifts help blur boundaries between corporate departments, e.g., 
data analytics, IT, and marketing departments attain more control over 
the accounting domain (Diller et al., 2020; Knudsen, 2020).

text:
Consequently, the literature dis­
cusses how this trend may make supply chains more local, decentralized, 
and closer to end-users (Weking et al., 2020).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Furthermore, DT creates 
opportunities for greater employee participation in the formulation of 
corporate strategic actions, and it enables real-time collective intelli­
gence.

traditional organizations.

text:
This notion provides an 
antidote to the otherwise strong emphasis on inclusion and collabora­
tion in the literature: DT also can lead to the exclusion and obsolescence 
of firms in their own supply chains.

text:
Continuing the “dark side” of DT for supply chains, the literature 
describes how DT may disrupt existing power relations between sup­
pliers and OEM customers by strengthening control of incumbents over 
network-level resources (Mosch et al., 2021) and enabling new entrants 
to dissolve existing hierarchies (Holmstr¨om et al., 2019; Ven­
drell-Herrero et al., 2017).

text:
In 
particular, marketing, advertising, and supply chain management are 
early targets of DT, as they can elicit fast and sizable gains for firms 
(Ghobakhloo, 2020; Guenzi & Habel, 2020; Taylor, 2017).

platforms as new organizational forms.

text:
Furthermore, the digi­
talization of business models has a tendency to trigger follow-up in­
novations, contributing to a chain reaction of interconnected and 
codependent innovation activities (Wiesbock & Hess, 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The conflict-based hypothesis builds on the idea 
that the decentralization of firms occurs independently of top manage­
ment when organizational units take control during technological 
change processes (Singh et al., 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
Driving forces and barriers of industry 4.0: Do 
multinational and small and medium-sized companies have equal opportunities?
metadata: title: Digital transformation: A review and research agenda; author: Dmitry Plekhanov; creationDate: D:20231222052905Z; modDate: D:20231222060601Z; subject: European Management Journal, 41 (2023) 821-844. doi:10.1016/j.emj.2022.09.007; keywords: Digital transformation,Digitalization,Digital ecosystems,Organizational change,Literature review

text:
The literature indicates that these competitive threats can drive the 
initiation of DT projects at firms, emphasizing that the interpretation of 
such external pressures remains subject to managerial perceptions 
(Cenamor et al., 2017; Kohtam¨aki et al., 2020).

text:
K E Y W O R D S
digital transformation, literature review, qualitative research, research agenda
1
|
INTRODUCTION
This paper's main objective is to combine practical and research-
related views on what we know and what we still need to learn about
business and management in the digital era.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: What we have learned (thus far) and what is next; author: Sabrina Schneider and Olga Kokshagina; creationDate: D:20210522074455Z00'00'; modDate: D:20250502181346-07'00'; subject: Creat Innov Manage 2021.30:384-411; keywords: 10.1111/caim.12414 and digital transformation; literature review; qualitative research; research agenda

text:
2
|
PRACTITIONER VIEW ON THE DIGITAL
TRANSFORMATION CHALLENGES IN 2017
2.1
|
Method and approach
Digital transformation is a practice-driven phenomenon.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: What we have learned (thus far) and what is next; author: Sabrina Schneider and Olga Kokshagina; creationDate: D:20210522074455Z00'00'; modDate: D:20250502181346-07'00'; subject: Creat Innov Manage 2021.30:384-411; keywords: 10.1111/caim.12414 and digital transformation; literature review; qualitative research; research agenda

text:

research agenda.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: What we have learned (thus far) and what is next; author: Sabrina Schneider and Olga Kokshagina; creationDate: D:20210522074455Z00'00'; modDate: D:20250502181346-07'00'; subject: Creat Innov Manage 2021.30:384-411; keywords: 10.1111/caim.12414 and digital transformation; literature review; qualitative research; research agenda

text:
The objective of this work was to combine
practical and research views on what is known and what are the
remaining challenges and research directions when it comes to digital
transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: What we have learned (thus far) and what is next; author: Sabrina Schneider and Olga Kokshagina; creationDate: D:20210522074455Z00'00'; modDate: D:20250502181346-07'00'; subject: Creat Innov Manage 2021.30:384-411; keywords: 10.1111/caim.12414 and digital transformation; literature review; qualitative research; research agenda

text:
The vast majority of the publications that
focus on how firms can manage the digital transformation has
appeared since 2017.

transformation
of
their
companies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation: What we have learned (thus far) and what is next; author: Sabrina Schneider and Olga Kokshagina; creationDate: D:20210522074455Z00'00'; modDate: D:20250502181346-07'00'; subject: Creat Innov Manage 2021.30:384-411; keywords: 10.1111/caim.12414 and digital transformation; literature review; qualitative research; research agenda
