text: Digital transformation strategies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Next,
we analyze the literature from multiple disciplines to discuss the phases
of digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Conclusion and research agenda
The key goal of this paper is to provide a multidisciplinary per-
spective on digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The phases of digital transformation
Given the multidisciplinary nature and broad coverage of digital
transformation research, we reviewed the multidisciplinary literature to
understand what is known about ﬁrms’ digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Drawing on extant literature, we identify three stages of digital transformation: digitization, digitalization, and
digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Based on our scoping review, we identify three
phases of digital transformation: digitization, digitalization, and digital
transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
To conclude, we believe that digital transformation will be a very
relevant, multidisciplinary area for future research given the recent
developments of digital technologies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: • How can digital resources facilitate digital transformation?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: The second goal of this review is to assess the diﬀerent phases of digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
First, we aim to assess how digital transformation has been studied across ﬁelds to address how digital
transformation has been conceptualized across the diﬀerent ﬁelds to identify key similarities and diﬀerences.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The apparent lack of
empirical research on the link between the diﬀerent phases of digital
transformation and performance leads to an important question: to
what degree should ﬁrms transform digitally?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
More-
over, digital transformation utilizes digital technologies to enable in-
teractions across borders with suppliers, customers and competitors
(Singh & Hess, 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In this paper, we have provided a
rich and timely discussion on digital transformation and proposed how
digital transformation places speciﬁc demands on organizations.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In sum, digital transformation is a company-wide phenomenon with
broad organizational implications in which, most notably, the core
business model of the ﬁrm is subject to change through the use of di-
gital technology (Agarwal et al., 2010; Iansiti & Lakhani, 2014; Li, in
press).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Moreover, this paper con-
tributes to existing literature on digital transformation in itself (e.g.,
Kumar, Ramachandran, & Kumar, in press; Verhoef & Bijmolt, in press),
because the emergence of digital transformation requires the building
of a scientiﬁc knowledge base and development of a research agenda to
stimulate the cumulativeness of future research in the multiple domains
on this important topic.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The need for digital transformation
We identify three major external factors driving the need for digital
transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital transformation is the most pervasive phase, and describes a
company-wide change that leads to the development of new business
models (Iansiti & Lakhani, 2014; Kane et al., 2015; Pagani & Pardo,
2017), which may be new to the focal ﬁrm or industry.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Despite the ubiquity and visible impact of digital transformation
and resultant new digital business models, the academic literature has
so far paid surprisingly little attention to these developments, only re-
cently starting to address the topics of digitization, digitalization, and
digital transformation (e.g., Venkatraman, 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Strategic imperatives of digital transformation
4.1.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Naturally, given the multidisciplinary nature of digital transforma-
tion and interdependencies that exist in business models (Christensen
et al., 2016), it is imperative that researchers from diﬀerent ﬁelds work
together to not only expand our knowledge on these ﬁve independent
themes, but also actively establish linkages between these themes and
disciplines to develop a more holistic understanding of why, how and
when digital transformation works.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
To conclude our discussion, we propose
a research agenda for future research on digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Therefore, we analyze the ﬁnal set of papers thematically to assess the important themes of digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
To the best of our knowledge, there has been no multidisciplinary
discussion on digital transformation, which we deﬁne as a change in how
a ﬁrm employs digital technologies, to develop a new digital business model
that helps to create and appropriate more value for the ﬁrm (Kane, Palmer,
Philips, Kiron, & Buckley, 2015; Liu, Chen, & Chou, 2011; Schallmo,
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022
Received 14 July 2018; Received in revised form 7 September 2019; Accepted 10 September 2019
☆This paper is based on discussions at the Thought leadership Conference on Digital Business Models and Analytics at the University of Groningen in April 2018.
entities: [('Kane', 'PERSON'), ('Kiron', 'ORG'), ('& Buckley', 'GPE'), ('2015', 'DATE'), ('Liu', 'PERSON'), ('Chen', 'PERSON'), ('2011', 'DATE'), ('Schallmo', 'GPE'), ('14 July 2018', 'DATE'), ('September 2019', 'DATE'), ('September 2019', 'DATE'), ('Digital Business Models and Analytics', 'ORG'), ('the University of Groningen', 'ORG'), ('April 2018', 'DATE')]
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital transformation: Opportunities to create new business
models.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In our subsequent discussion
we mostly — but not exclusively — focus on the digital transformation
stage, as this is the most pervasive and complex phase, and the main
focus of our paper.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Hence, this review also assesses how digital transformation has been studied across ﬁelds (including related
constructs) to identify their similarities and diﬀerences.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital transformation aﬀects the whole company and its ways of
doing business (Amit & Zott, 2001) and goes beyond digitalization —
the changing of simple organizational processes and tasks.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: • What is the impact of digital transformation on performance?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
This capability becomes in-
creasingly important when a ﬁrm shifts to more advanced phases of
digital transformation; that is, from digitization to digitalization, and
from digitalization to digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Strategy, not
technology, drives digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We included the keywords “digitalize”, “digital transformation”, and “digitize” as well as
“IT” or “IS” in combination with “transformation” to cover the broad meaning of digital transformation and account for varieties in the focus across
diﬀerent disciplines.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: How big old companies navigate digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We identify and delineate growth strategies for digital ﬁrms as well as the assets and
capabilities required in order to successfully transform digitally.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
First, more research is required to understand how ﬁrms go
through the phases of digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Overall, we need to know more on how
digital resources facilitate digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The diﬀerent phases of digital changes toward digital transforma-
tion have important strategic imperatives for ﬁrms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: • What organizational structures are most eﬀective for digital transformation?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We
start
with
a
discussion
on
the
external
drivers
of
digital
transformation, which presents the background of our discussion.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
What is the
relative impact of each of them in shaping the success of digital
transformation?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In pursuit of
digital transformation, the ﬁrm’s redeﬁnition of how it creates and
delivers value to customers often requires it to access, acquire or de-
velop new digital assets and capabilities.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: • How can we measure digital transformation phases and digital readiness?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Digital transformation is particularly relevant for incumbent ﬁrms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Journal of Business Research xxx (xxxx) xxx–xxx
3
Therefore, digital transformation is inherently linked to strategic
changes in the business model as a result of the implementation of di-
gital technologies (Sebastian et al., 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: • To what degree should ﬁrms transform digitally?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The ﬁrst decision for our literature search is to select the
relevant ﬁelds of interest to conceptualize digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Im-
portantly, not only ﬁrms in the digital transformation phase, but also
ﬁrms in the digitalization phase can embrace these market-develop-
ment strategies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We believe that such a multidisciplinary
discussion is required, given that digital transformation is multi-
disciplinary by nature, as it involves changes in strategy, organization,
information technology, supply chains and marketing.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Papers should use digital transformation-related concepts as major constructs.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
And, what is the impact
of the diﬀerent phases of digital transformation on performance?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We started with a discussion on why
ﬁrms need to transform digitally and conclude that digital transfor-
mation occurs in response to changes in digital technologies, increasing
digital competition and resulting digital customer behavior.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Based on prior literature, we
assume that incumbent ﬁrms go through the same sequence of digiti-
zation, digitalization, and then to digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Finally,
we provide a research agenda to stimulate and guide future research on digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
• What ﬁrm and market variables moderate the relationship between digital
transformation and performance?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
From a human resource management perspective, digital
transformation implies the attraction of employees with digital and
analytical skills that may replace existing workforce.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
• What is the relative impact of identiﬁed assets and capabilities on digital transformation
and performance?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
How chief digital oﬃcers promote the digital transformation
of their companies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The digital transformation of
traditional businesses.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The relevance and use of KPIs may
diﬀer across the phases of digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Future research can also try to measure
and investigate how digital readiness of ﬁrms may help the transition
through the phases of digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Scholars have used a variety of concepts as substitutes or
complimentary elements when theorizing about ﬁrms’ digital transformation such as e-business usage to describe digital transformation (e.g., Zhu,
Dong, Xu, & Kraemer, 2006).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In order to provide managerial guidance for digital
transformation, we must increase our understanding of how ﬁrms can
gain a sustainable competitive advantage by building on speciﬁc re-
sources, which strategies they should adopt to win, and how the ﬁrm’s
internal organization structure must change to support these strategies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Given that the same keyword can have a (partly) diﬀerent meaning in other disciplines, we argue that this thematic analysis helps us to better
conceptualize digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Although digital transformation seems inevitable in many
industries, still it should not be considered an end in itself, given the
deep changes needed and high risks involved.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Second, to discuss the
strategic imperatives that result from digital transformation regarding
(1) required digital resources, (2) required organizational structure, (3)
growth strategies, and (4) required metrics.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We hope future research will focus on identifying the optimal
forms of organizational structures that allow ﬁrms to succeed in ex-
ecuting their digital transformation strategies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Flow Model for Discussion on Digital Transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We have the following
three objectives: First, to identify the external factors that have
strengthened the need for digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Past research
argues that digital transformation has implications for the organiza-
tional structure (Sklyar, Kowalkowski, Tronvoll, & Sörhammar, in
press), favoring a ﬂexible structure composed of separate business
units, agile organizational forms, and digital functional areas.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Given the possible
incompatibility of realizing both objectives, some researchers suggest
that digitally transforming incumbents should develop digital in-
itiatives in new separate ventures that would function similarly to a
digital start-up in order to justify a primary focus on growth
(Christensen et al., 2016).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital
transformation introduces a new business model by implementing a
new business logic to create and capture value (e.g., Pagani & Pardo,
2017; Zott & Amit, 2008).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
As discussed above, digital transformation has several
important implications for the organization structure.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We posit that digital transformation requires
speciﬁc organizational structures and bears consequences for the metrics used to calibrate performance.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Next, by
analyzing the literature, we identify three stages for digital transfor-
mation: digitization, digitalization and digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We conducted a scoping review approach (Paré, Trudel, Jaana, &
Kitsiou, 2015) to understand how the multiple disciplines have con-
ceptualized and deﬁned digital transformation (See Appendix A).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
2 The focus of our discussion is on identifying relevant digital resources that
ﬁrms need to transform their business digitally.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Major Topic
Relevant Disciplines
Research Questions
Phases of Digital Transformation
Information systems, strategic management,
innovation
• How should move ﬁrms through multiple digital transformation phases?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Papers should include some theoretical notions for digital transformation (or related constructs); either by providing a theoretical notion based on
earlier work, or by developing a notion of what is exactly meant with digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Table 1 shows the
variety of growth strategies across digital transformation phases, and
indicates that platform strategies are more common for the more per-
vasive phases of digital change.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Finally, little is known about to which degree ﬁrms should transform
digitally.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Metrics and Goals
Strategic management, marketing, operations
management
• Which metrics are essential for the diﬀerent phases of digital transformation?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
1) to describe the drivers, phases or levels, and imperatives of
digital transformation (cf.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Rapid adaption in digital
transformation: A participatory process for enaging IS and business leaders.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We acknowledge that including other ﬁelds could be of interest to study digital
transformation, but that we need to strike a balance between covering everything and being relevant.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Hence, ignoring contributions from speciﬁc ﬁelds would bias our understanding of digital
transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
And, more
broadly, what organizational structures are most eﬀective for ﬁrms that
transform digitally?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
A cross-discipline exchange of knowledge helps to
better grasp the strategic imperatives of digital transformation, as it
involves multiple functional areas, including marketing, information
systems, innovations, strategic and operations management.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Organizational structure
Apart from the digital resources needed to achieve digital trans-
formation, a key issue to consider is the organizational changes needed
to adapt to digital change (Eggers & Park, 2018), especially regarding
organizational structure that is ﬂexible for digital change.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital transformation by SME en-
trepreneurs: A capability perspective.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The Digital Matrix: New Rules for Business Transformation Through
Technology.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Tackling the digitali-
zation challenge: How to beneﬁt from digitalization in practice.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Papers should use the concepts related to digital transformation in the core of the theoretical section (e.g., by being included in hypotheses,
propositions and/or research model) to make sure that digital transformation played a key role in the development of the paper.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We
hope that our discussion and research agenda will stimulate future re-
search on digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The organization structure of digital transformation is the third im-
portant theme.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Today’s ﬁrms
invest
heavily
in
the
development
and
acquisition
of
digital
Table 1
Strategic Imperatives according to Phases of Digital Transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Based on an understanding of these phases,
we discuss the strategic imperatives that result from digital transfor-
mation, including digital resources, organizational structure, growth
strategy, and metrics and goals.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: • How to construct self-organizing teams to attain digital transformation?

Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Perhaps incumbents should skip the phase of digita-
lization to realize digital transformation, as this phase may hinder or
obstruct digital transformation.

Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital Transformation of business
models — Best practice, enablers, and roadmap.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Although perhaps not each of these technologies
will be as powerful as expected, the wide entrance of new digital
technologies clearly signals the need for ﬁrms to transform their busi-
ness digitally.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digitalization describes how IT or digital technologies can be used to
alter existing business processes (Li et al., 2016).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
For practitioners, it is necessary to bring
together the insights from information systems, marketing, strategic
management, innovation, and operations management in order to make
sound organization-wide decisions about how to respond to digital
technologies and implement digital organizational changes.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
• Which growth strategies should incumbent ﬁrms use when digital transforming their
ﬁrm?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digitalization capabilities as enables of value
co-creation in servitizing ﬁrms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Most of the literature subscribes that the ﬁrst two more
incremental phases are needed to attain the most pervasive phase of
digital transformation (Loebbecke & Picot, 2015; Matt, Hess, & Benlian,
2015; Parviainen, Tihinen, Kääriäinen, & Teppola, 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In
doing so, we need to gain a better understanding of the contextual in-
ﬂuences and determine which internal ﬁrm (ﬁrm size, age, board
composition) and external market factors (e.g., competition intensity,
products vs. services, technological intensity) may moderate the impact
of digital transformation on ﬁrm performance.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
These ﬁelds include most of the “classic” business research ﬁelds and
cover a variety of important views on digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Introduction
Digital transformation and resultant business model innovation
have fundamentally altered consumers’ expectations and behaviors,
pressured
traditional
ﬁrms,
and
disrupted
numerous
markets.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
For
instance, digital transformation in the healthcare sector is manifested
by broad and deep use of IT that fundamentally changes the provision
of healthcare services (Agarwal, Gao, DesRoches, & Jha, 2010).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In the phase of digital transformation,
the capability to acquire and analyze big data for decision making is
crucial
(Dremel,
Wulf,
Herterich,
Waizmann,
&
Brenner,
2017;
Loebbecke & Picot, 2015), given that the functionality of digital tech-
nologies all rely on digital data.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In digitalization, IT serves as a key
enabler to seize new business possibilities by changing existing business
processes, such as communication (Ramaswamy & Ozcan, 2016; Van
Doorn et al., 2010), distribution (Leviäkangas, 2016), or business re-
lationship management (Baraldi & Nadin, 2006).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Our
review of the diﬀerent ﬁelds of information systems, marketing, in-
novation, and strategy reveals that all streams identify multiple phases
or stages1 of digital change, ranging from relatively simple to more
pervasive changes.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital transformation in latecomer industries: CIO and
CEO leadership lessons from Encana Oil & Gas (USA) Inc. MIS Quarterly Executive,
10(4), 175–186.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digitization
Digitalization
Digital Transformation
Information systems
management
• Encode or transform analog to digital
information/tasks (Agarwal et al., 2010;
Anderson & Agarwal, 2011; Davison & Ou,
2017; Loebbecke & Picot, 2015; Matt et al.,
2015; Parviainen et al., 2017; Tan & Pan, 2003;
Whelan, Golden, & Donnellan, 2013; Xue,
Zhang, Ling, & Zhao, 2013; Yoo et al., 2010;
Zhu et al., 2006)
• Change processes by adding
technology (Leviäkangas, 2016;
Parviainen et al., 2017)
• Utilize digital technology to facilitate change
(Agarwal et al., 2010; Zhu et al., 2006)
• Change roles between company, customer and
competitor (Karimi & Walter, 2015; Parviainen
et al., 2017)
• Create new value (Li et al., 2018; Matt et al., 2015)
Marketing management
• Implement IT to analog tasks to create
information (Coreynen, Matthyssens, & Van
Bockhaven, 2017; Johnson & Bharadwaj, 2005;
Lai et al., 2010; Vendrell-Herrero et al., 2017)
• Connect customers and ﬁrms (Pagani
& Pardo, 2017; Ramaswamy & Ozcan,
2016)
• Connect machines with each other
(IoT) (Lenka, Parida, & Wincent,
2017)
• Reshape consumer preferences, create new value
for consumers, change ﬁrm relationships,
develop new value propositions (Pagani & Pardo,
2017; Vendrell-Herrero et al., 2017)
Strategic management
• Encode or transform analog to digital
information to enable new tasks (Dougherty &
Dunne, 2012; Iansiti & Lakhani, 2014)
• Reduce costs (Greenstein, Lerner, & Stern,
2013; Kohli & Johnson, 2011)
• Enable new products (Saarikko, Westergren, &
Blomquist, 2017; Sebastian et al., 2017)
• Generate new knowledge and
business opportunities (Dougherty &
Dunne, 2012; Hansen & Sia, 2015)
• Restructure business with digital technology to
attain competitive advantage (Berman, 2012;
Iansiti & Lakhani, 2014; Kane et al., 2015;
Peppard, Edwards, & Lambert, 2011; Singh &
Hess, 2017)
• Create new business opportunities and business
models (Andal-Ancion, Cartwright, & Yip, 2003;
Hansen, Kraemmergaard, & Mathiassen, 2011; Liu
et al., 2011; Peppard et al., 2011)
Innovation
management
• Convert analog to digital information (Katz &
Koutroumpis, 2013; Li, in press; Øiestad &
Bugge, 2014)
• Reduce costs (Øiestad & Bugge, 2014)
• Enable new opportunities for the company to
generate innovation (Aubert-Tarby, Escobar, &
Rayna, 2016; Borreau, Gensollen, Moreau, &
Waelbroeck, 2012; Kolloch & Dellermann,
2017)
• Connect or restructure processes to
create opportunities (Baraldi &
Nadin, 2006; Ho & Lee, 2015)
• Change a ﬁrm’s value network, customers and
competitors (Li, in press; Schallmo et al., 2017)
Operations
management
• Convert analog to digital data (Gölzer &
Fritzsche, 2017; Li et al., 2016)
• Use ICT within ﬁrm (Plomp & Batenburg, 2010)
• Improve process quality or products
with digital technology (Kompalla,
Geldmacher, Just, & Lange, 2017; Li
et al., 2016)
• Interconnect products and production systems to
global product networks (Gölzer & Fritzsche,
2017)
