Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
• How does ﬁrms’ use and importance of metrics evolve across the diﬀerent phases of
digital transformation?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Such interdisciplinary research
helps practitioners to make sound strategic decisions about how to re-
spond to digital technologies and implement digital change.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Third, to present a research
agenda that guides future (inter)disciplinary research on digital trans-
formation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Especially in the digital transformation phase intermediate
“digital” metrics are valuable, as they provide more ﬁne-grained in-
sights.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The digital transformation of business models in the creative industries: A
holistic framework and emerging trends.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The digital transformation of
healthcare: Current status and the road ahead.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Firms aiming to transform
digitally not only need to have digital assets, but also acquire or de-
velop capabilities related to digital agility, digital networking and big
Fig.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Which sets of
intermediate and outcome-based metrics should ﬁrms use to measure
their value creation and business performance during the diﬀerent
phases of digital transformation?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In this section, we will high-
light the most essential digital assets and capabilities needed for digital
change: digital assets, digital agility, digital networking capability and
big data analytics capability.2
Digital assets.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Realizing strategic value through center-
edge digital transformation in consumer-centric industries.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: • How resilient are incumbent ﬁrms against digital competition and digital change?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Such a
change often involves the organization of new sociotechnical structures
with digital artifacts, which were not possible without digital technol-
ogies (Dougherty & Dunne, 2012).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Through digitalization
ﬁrms apply digital technologies to optimize existing business processes
by allowing a more eﬃcient coordination between processes, and/or by
creating additional customer value through enhancing user experiences
(Pagani & Pardo, 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: • What is driving the success of speciﬁc digital growth strategies?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
How does ﬁrms’ use and importance
of metrics evolve across the diﬀerent phases of digital transformation?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Hence, digital technologies can help to attain a
competitive advantage by transforming the organization to leverage
existing core competences or develop new ones (Liu et al., 2011).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Until now, digital
change has received most attention within speciﬁc business disciplines.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital Resources
Information systems, strategic management,
innovation
• How can ﬁrms develop speciﬁc digital resources?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We discuss these digital
capabilities that can enhance the value of digital assets in the section
below.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In pursuit of digital transformation, ﬁrms thus search for and
implement business model innovation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The capability of
ﬁrms to select, attract, link and engage a heterogeneous set of network
stakeholders like customers, suppliers, and third parties strongly sti-
mulates the value creation and growth of platforms (McIntyre &
Srinivasan, 2017; Thomas, Autio, & Gann, 2014), and is important to
realize digitalization and digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
To achieve digital transformation, digital agility is needed to re-
combine digital assets with other organizational resources in order to
change the way of doing business.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital transformation
Introduction of new business models like ‘product-
as-a-service’, digital platforms, and pure data-
driven business models
[Above] +
Big data analytics
capability
Separate units with ﬂexible
organizational forms, internalization
of IT and analytical functional areas
[Above] +
Platform diversiﬁcation
Digital KPIs:
Digital share, magnitude
and momentum,
co-creator sentiment
New cost-revenue model:
Reconﬁguration of assets to develop
new business models.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Resource ﬁt in digital transformation –
Lessons learned from the CBC bank global e-banking project.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In the remaining of
the paper, we refer to phases to indicate the pervasiveness of the digital change
a ﬁrm undertakes.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Incumbents
may start with minor changes (e.g., digitization or digitalization) to
gradually transform their traditional business into a digital one.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Should digital transforming ﬁrms adopt self-
organizing teams instilled with autonomy and ﬂexibility?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In this paper, we aim to reﬂect on the phenomenon and the litera-
ture from multiple ﬁelds to aid an understanding of digital transfor-
mation and to stimulate future research by providing strategic im-
peratives and presenting a research agenda.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Data-driven operations management: Organisational
implications of the digital transformation in industrial practice.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital
technologies allow consumers to co-create value by designing and
customizing products, perform last-mile distribution activities, and help
other customers by sharing product reviews (Beckers, van Doorn, &
Verhoef, 2018; Grönroos & Voima, 2013).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
This paper thus contributes to existing discussions on digital transfor-
mation by taking a multidisciplinary focus.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Digital functional areas.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
To respond to these challenges, ﬁrms should be digitally
agile to continuously modify and reconﬁgure existing digital assets and
capabilities (Eggers & Park, 2018; Lavie, 2006).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Finally, we discuss the importance of devel-
oping new (intermediate) digital metrics and objectives for digital
ﬁrms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In the information systems literature, researchers have tradi-
tionally paid strong attention to technical developments regarding
adoption and use of digital technologies and resultant business value
(e.g., Nambisan, Lyytinen, Majchrzak, & Song, 2017; Sambamurthy,
Bharadwaj, & Grover, 2003).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The primary objective of
many digital ﬁrms is to achieve growth in the sheer number of users of
the digital ecosystem (e.g., suppliers, customers, third parties) to create
reinforcing network eﬀects that enable further platform growth.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digitization, innovation, and copyright:
What is the agenda?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Reinventing the IT function: the
role of IT agility and IT ambidexterity in supporting digital business transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The move to digital may
often require a marked departure from the status quo, and may lead to
the obsolescence of existing business models (Teece, 2010).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Hence, digitalization is not only focused on
cost savings, but also includes process improvements that may enhance
customer experiences.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Another concept requiring
scholarly attention is digital resilience of ﬁrms, focusing on whether
incumbent ﬁrms are able to compete with (new) digital players and
accommodate exogenous shocks from disruptive digital technologies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In retail, technologies have disrupted the com-
petition landscape, shifting sales to relatively young digital ﬁrms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Firms often do not realize that — apart from changing the functional
role of IT department — the employees’ digital skills in marketing and
service operations also need to be upgraded to enhance value creation
(e.g., Lemon & Verhoef, 2016; Vomberg, Homburg, & Bornemann,
2015).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We do not claim that our
identiﬁed digital resources are unique to the digital context; for instance, digital
agility and digital networking capability partially overlap with the resources of
networking and dynamic capability as identiﬁed in the strategic management
literature.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:

analog into digital information

based) Market development,
Product development

Cost-to-serve, ROI, ROA
Cost savings:
More eﬃcient deployment of
resources for existing activities.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
To what extent do digital agility and digital networking
capability only help digital ﬁrms, or are these capabilities also be re-
levant for less digital ﬁrms?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Hoﬀman & Novak, 2017; Verhoef et al., 2017), and,
consequently, the use of new digital technologies can easily become the
new norm and defy traditional business rules.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Third, consumer behavior is changing as a response to the digital
revolution.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
An important feature of digital transforma-
tion is the increased reliance on IT and analytical functions.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Metrics and goals
To realize the full potential of digital transformation, digital ﬁrms
need to measure the performance improvements on key performance
indicators (KPIs) to facilitate learning and ﬁne-tune the business model,
as we discuss in this subsection.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
While we have identiﬁed several important digital assets and cap-
abilities, future research is needed for answering an array of related
questions: How can these digital resources be developed?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital growth strategies
A variety of digital growth strategies exist for digital ﬁrms, but the
most prominent growth strategy involves the use of digital platforms
(Broekhuizen et al., in press; Parker et al., 2016).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Firms require digital assets, like the storage of data,
information and communication infrastructure, and accompanying
technologies to eﬀectively compete in the digital era.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Digital networking capability.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital Growth Strategies
Strategic management, marketing
• What should be the diversiﬁcation strategy of digital platforms?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Innovation diﬀusion in global
contexts: Determinants of post-adoption digital transformation of European compa-
nies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Hence, incumbents, which want to transform digitally, need to
simultaneously attain two main objectives: reducing costs through au-
tomation and growing revenues through enhanced customer experience
(e.g., Lemon & Verhoef, 2016; Verhoef et al., 2015).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In environments increasingly permeated
with digital technologies, ﬁrms realize that they need to take a network-
centric view and co-create value with a set of digitally connected ﬁrms
(Koch & Windsperger, 2017; Libert, Beck, & Wind, 2016).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Each
phase places speciﬁc demands on ﬁrms’ digital resources, organization
structure, growth strategies and metrics.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The role of dynamic capabilities in responding to digital
disruption: A factor-based study of the newspaper industry.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
To summarize, we describe the
key characteristics of digitization, digitalization and digital transfor-
mation in Table 1.

text:
These
new digital technologies are likely to structurally change consumer
behavior (cf.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The digital networking capability,
which refers to the ﬁrm’s ability to bring together and match distinct
users to address their mutual needs via digital means, becomes more
important in digital settings.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Incumbents will face challenges and barriers when searching and im-
plementing business model innovation for digital transformation given
their legacy.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The shifting of customer roles into producers or
suppliers is rather ﬁrms that have transformed digitally, while we do
rarely observe these far-stretched co-creation strategies for ﬁrms in
earlier phases.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: The fourth important theme concerns digital growth strategies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The network imperative: How to survive and grow in
the age of digital business models.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In today’s busi-
ness world, managers are increasingly confronted with responding to
the advent of new digital technologies that blur market boundaries and
change agent roles (e.g., customers become co-producers, competitors
become collaborators, and ﬁrms that vertically integrate or bypass ex-
isting parties).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digitalization
Use of robots in production; Addition of digital
components to product or service oﬀering;
Introduction of digital distribution and
communication channels.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital innovation man-
agement: Reinventing innovation management research in a digital world.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Prior research has considered the use of speciﬁc metrics within mar-
keting (e.g., Katsikeas, Morgan, Leonidou, & Hult, 2016), but more
research is required to assess how digital transformation may aﬀect the
usage and usefulness of performance metrics.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: • What are digital networking capabilities and how can ﬁrms develop them?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The impact of digital technology on relationships in a
business network.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Second, due to these new digital technologies, competition is
changing dramatically.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Reﬂections on societal and business model transfor-
mation arising from digitization and big data analytics: A research agenda.

Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We specify their
impacts on required digital resources, organizational structure, digital
growth strategies, and metrics in Table 1.

text: The second important research theme concerns digital resources.

text:
Hummel’s digital transformation toward omnichannel
retailing: Key lessons learned.

text:
Furthermore, papers were excluded when mentioning
digital transformation only as a possible implication of other research done.

text:
The new organizing logic of digital in-
novation: An agenda for information systems research.

text:
How AUDI
AG established big data analytics in its digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Research also refers to digitization as a change of analog to digital tasks
(Li, Nucciarelli, Roden, & Graham, 2016; Sebastian et al., 2017), or
conceptualized it as the integration of IT with existing tasks, and, more
broadly, as the development or enabler of cost-eﬀective resource con-
ﬁgurations using IT (Lai, Wong, & Cheng, 2010; Vendrell-Herrero,
Bustinza, Parry, & Georgantzis, 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Seeing through the network: Competitive advantage
in the digital economy.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital ubiquity: How connections, sensors, and data
are revolutionizing business.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Digital Growth Strategies for Platform Firms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
For instance, should the focus be on the acquisition of digital
assets, the development of digital networking or big data analytics
capabilities?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Organizing for digital
servitization: A service ecosystem perspective.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
For digitally transforming incumbents, achieving high growth is
also important, but not at the cost of proﬁtability.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Most no-
tably, the IT function itself needs to transform from a line function
focused on enabling communication or data ﬂows into a more proactive
and orchestrating role supportive to digital value creation via fast and
explorative responses (Leonhardt, Haﬀke, Kranz, & Benlian, 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In today’s dynamic and
unpredictable markets, ﬁrms must be ﬂexible: (1) to allow for the re-
peated switching of organizational roles; (2) to respond to the changing
customer needs and introduction of new digital technologies; and (3) to
respond to the intensiﬁed competition due to the blurring of market
boundaries and removal of entry barriers (Chakravarty et al., 2013; Lee
et al., 2015).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
To stimulate their digital agility (see Section 4.1), ﬁrms
require ﬂexible organization forms that allow for fast responses to
constant digital change.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Based on the above, we deﬁne
digitization to describe the action to convert analog information into
digital information.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Measuring digitization: A growth and welfare
multiplier.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Digitalisation of Finland’s transport sector.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Based on this, which growth strategies should ﬁrms choose, and how
can incumbent ﬁrms achieve similar growth ﬁgures as digital entrants?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Hence,
to what extent are digital industry leaders more capable of ﬁnding,
selecting and executing digital projects, or does their success depend on
other factors?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The impact of technological change
on employment: The case of press digitisation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Although the end goal of new business models — as generated by di-
gital transformation — will also be to generate revenues, proﬁts and
improve investor value (Teece, 2010), here it is also particularly useful
to track intermediate results via process-related metrics to assess how
well the new digital business model is creating value (Libert et al.,
2016).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Shaping agility through digital
options: Reconceptualizing the role of information technology in contemporary ﬁrms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
While certain adjustments and updates of metrics usually happen
when a ﬁrm goes through digitization and digitalization phases (e.g.,
measuring website clicks, video views and mobile downloads, after the
introduction of online and mobile channels), overall outcome-related
metrics like ROI, proﬁtability and revenue growth, typically remain
relevant for ﬁrms that engage in digitization and digitalization.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
To better understand how digital ﬁrms can grow using a platform
business model, we rely on the Ansoﬀmatrix, which identiﬁes four
growth strategies: market penetration, product development, market
development and diversiﬁcation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Treating
digital transformation — as existent research has done — in functional
silos would potentially lead to ignoring relevant aspects or not opti-
mizing cross-fertilization opportunities.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital science and knowledge boundaries in complex
innovation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
• How can transforming ﬁrms beneﬁt from new organizational structures and
management styles?
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The use of standard, more hierarchical
organization schemes, with multiple management layers and a strong
top-down approach, may no longer be eﬀective in fast-changing digital
environments, as the bureaucracy involved reduces response speed and
innovativeness.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The reason for the
year 2000 as cutoﬀline is that in this year the dotcom bubble collapsed and that ﬁrms such as Google, Amazon or eBay were among the survivors
which today have huge inﬂuence on what we understand about digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The ﬁrst strategy, (4) product development, introduced by Ansoﬀ,
can also be followed by digital ﬁrms.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The challenges in digitalising business relationships: The
construction of an IT infrastructure for a textile-related business network.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Typically, digitization mainly
digitalizes internal and external documentation processes, but does not
change value creation activities.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Information Systems Research, 24(4), 976–997.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
We also do not claim that our list of resources is exhaustive as digital
ﬁrms may require additional digital and nondigital resources to successfully
transform their business.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digitisation of publishing: Exploration based on ex-
isting business models.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Using the lens of a digital platform, we ﬁnd new themes and growth
strategies that broaden the conceptualization of Ansoﬀ’s growth matrix.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital resources
Resources represent a ﬁrm’s ownership and control of assets and
capabilities (Barney, 1991).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
However, em-
pirical research on the organization structure within digital ﬁrms is
scarce.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Servitization,
digitization and supply chain interdependency.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Managing e-transformation in the public sector: An e-
government study of the inland revenue authority of Singapore (IRAS).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital ﬁrms can often more ef-
ﬁciently develop and launch new products in a platform environment,
as platforms allow for stronger synergies among products.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
• Which metrics are important for digital platforms given the increasing reliance on
networks and eco-systems?

Capability reconﬁguration: An analysis of incumbent responses to

metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. text:
Information Systems Research,
21(4), 724–735.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The reason to choose a multi-
disciplinary approach rather than focusing on contributions within one research ﬁeld is because we believe that a broad phenomenon like digital
transformation with wide implications for ﬁrms and society cannot be fully understood by only studying it within, for instance, the IS ﬁeld
(Loebbecke & Picot, 2015).

text:

digm theory with validation and generalization from case studies.

text: Information Systems Research, 22(3), 469–490.

text:
This section explains the origins of the
fast-paced growth of digital platforms, and identiﬁes new digital
growth strategies based on the classic Ansoﬀmatrix (Ansoﬀ, 1957).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
At
the company level, many traditional ﬁrms have been surpassed by in-
novative fast-growing digital entrants, and suﬀered as a result of this.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

[Above] +
Digital agility,
Digital
networking
capability

penetration, Co-creation
platform

Digital KPIs:
User experience, Unique
customers/users, active
customers/users

metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. text:
Information Systems Research, 21(4),
796–809.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Information Systems Research, 26(2),
398–417.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
By continuously sensing and seizing
market opportunities, digital agility fosters the recombination and de-
velopment of new products, services and business models that enhance
the
value
created
for
the
customer
(Karimi
&
Walter,
2015;
Sambamurthy et al., 2003; Teece, 2010).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
A near ubiquitous characteristic of digital ﬁrms, and digital plat-
forms in particular, is their impressive growth ﬁgures.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Moreover, these new digital technologies may also aﬀect
the ﬁrm’s cost structure through replacing costlier humans during ser-
vice delivery with the help of robots or virtual agents or optimizing
logistic streams and reducing supply chain costs through the use of AI
and blockchain.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Platforms can leverage their digital
– and disruptive (Christensen, 1997) – technologies to achieve sig-
niﬁcant growth by attracting non-users, who have never consumed the
product or a traditional substitute before, into customers.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
For example, Volvo Cars is hiring C-suite digital oﬃcers and
dedicates a major part of its R&D investment to digital initiatives to
speed up digital projects such as autonomous driving and concierge
services.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
In addition to these more traditional strategies, digital ﬁrms can also
execute (3) platform-based market penetration, introducing a platform
consisting of various existing products into a new market that are of-
fered by external parties.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The literature streams on innovation management
and software development have extensively investigated self-organizing
teams (e.g., Takeuchi & Nonaka, 1986), but there is a paucity of re-
search on how self-organizing teams enable digital transformation and
its eﬀect on performance.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. • Which organizational structures enhance ﬁrms’ digital agility?

models: A framework and overview of the special issue.

cumbent ﬁrms: How Volvo cars managed competing concerns.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. text:
Papers were excluded when the digital transformation was only
included in the keywords, abstract or introduction but not further explained in the text.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
If ﬁrms cannot adapt to
these changes, they become less attractive to customers, and are likely
to be replaced by ﬁrms that do leverage such technologies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
As incumbents tend to be slow when it comes
to detecting valuable technologies, recognizing the need to react fast,
and/or overcoming the often conﬂictive and competence-destroying
nature of digital technologies is critical (Christensen & Overdorf, 2000;
Christensen et al., 2016; Venkatraman, 2017).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digital agility concerns the ability to sense and seize
market
opportunities
provided
by
digital
technologies
(Lee,
Sambamurthy, Kim, & Wei, 2015; Lu & Ramamurthy, 2011; Tallon &
Pinsonneault, 2011).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
The use
of IT is transformative and leads to fundamental changes to existing
business processes, routines and capabilities, and allow healthcare
providers to enter new or exit current markets (Li et al., 2018).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Digitization is the encoding of analog information into a digital
format (i.e., into zeros and ones) such that computers can store process,
and transmit such information (Dougherty & Dunne, 2012; Loebbecke &
Picot, 2015; Tan & Pan, 2003; Yoo, Henfridsson, & Lyytinen, 2010).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
For example,
big data (i.e., customer journey data) as a digital asset can be leveraged
by using a ﬁrm’s data analytical capabilities to personalize services and
oﬀers (e.g., Verhoef, Kooge, & Walk, 2016).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Risk mitigation in supply chain digiti-
zation: System modularity and information technology governance.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Furthermore, given the
increasing presence of digital platforms, more research is needed to
understand how speciﬁc metrics aﬀect these ﬁrms, and how such me-
trics may help them to make more informed strategic decisions.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Digital agility.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
For example, in their digital transformation
journey ING has adopted the so-called Spotify-model with self-steering
teams that have their own responsibility to act.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text: Value creation in e-business.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Further-
more, ﬁrms may allow customers on their digital platforms to co-create
value by generating own content, customize their products, and become
brand ambassadors via the use of social media technologies (Dong &
Wu, 2015), making customers a valuable asset for generating compe-
titive advantage (Prahalad & Ramaswamy, 2000).
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. Verhoef; creationDate: D:20191101204821Z; modDate: D:20191101204821Z; subject: Journal of Business Research,Corrected proof,doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2019.09.022; keywords: Digital business; Business models; Business strategy;

text:
Tailored automotive business
strategies in the context of digitalization and service-oriented models.

text:
Examples concern the use of digital forms in or-
dering processes, the use of digital surveys, or the use digital applica-
tions for internal ﬁnancial declarations.
metadata: title: Digital transformation_ A multidisciplinary reflection and research agenda; author: Peter C. text:
Furthermore, this timeframe is in line with other recently
published reviews about digital in general (e.g., Kannan & Li, 2017).

Although incumbents can be successful in deploying new digital tech-
nologies, successful business cases seem to be rare.

businesses.
