text:
Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation 
1.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
To be or not to be digital, that is 
the question: Firm innovation and performance.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Concluding remarks 
This special issue greatly deepens our knowledge on digital trans­
formation and on different areas of related and interconnected research, 
such as new digital skills and the capabilities they require, the emer­
gence of new business models and transformation within key industries, 
and the new role and new behaviours of consumers.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
How and which forms of dynamic capabilities should be devel­
oped by firms to embrace digital innovation remains unclear, in which 
contexts (e.g.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
The digital transformation era 
thus evokes a need for more digital skills and if the introduction of new 
technologies was pushed by the advancement of innovations before, now 
it is possible to emphasise the importance of digital and human skills for 
business growth.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
(this issue) investi­
gate the way that digital innovation promotes new business models 
through the optimisation of new knowledge.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
This research looked at the internal-external critical and dynamic 
capabilities affecting the digital innovation of firms, in terms of new 
products or processes, using varied digital technologies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Contributions 
The main contribution of this special issue may be summed up by 
grouping the papers into four main areas of research: a) digital skills and 
capabilities; b) new business models and transformation within key in­
dustries; c) new role and new behaviours of consumers; d) effects and 
outcomes of digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
New business models and transformation within key industries 
The second group of papers focuses more on how whole industries 
have been affected by digital transformation, with some key papers 
addressing the relevant issue of the emergence of new business models 
or the need to pursue business model innovation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
This alternative and original view of digital 
technologies suggests that a firm’s survival and value creation in the 
long-term is still based on investments in traditional mechanisms of 
innovative knowledge creation, suggesting that there should be more 
focus on the development of digital skills and competencies.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
The discussion is still ongoing around digital transformation in 
business and management, but we believe the scholars published in this 
special issue have delivered an important development of the topic, and 
we thank them for their scientific and human contribution.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Digital 
transformation is not limited to particularly innovative businesses, 
digital start-ups and high-tech giants, however, but is rather a process 
that embraces companies of all sizes, operating in the most diverse in­
dustries (Ferraris, Mazzoleni, Devalle, & Couturier, 2019; Warner & 
W¨ager, 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
The authors confirm the relevance 
of dynamic capabilities in the digital arena, and that the absence of such 
practices could throw these companies out of the market over the years, 
due to the underlying lack of acquisition and implementation of 
adequate capabilities.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
The last paper in this group is “Digital transformation and customer 
value creation in Made in Italy SMEs: A dynamic capabilities perspec­
tive” written by Matarazzo et al.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Digital skills and capabilities 
The first group reflects the need to upgrade the skills and capabilities 
of existing organisations, and the emergence of new key capabilities in 
the digital transformation era, such as analytics that impact business 
performances (e.g.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
(this issue) is another attempt to look at the 
abilities of firms in the nowadays digital arena in light of the dynamic 
capabilities theoretical stream of research.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
In this vein, digital transformation is 
structured as a combination of nine influential elements in three cate­
gories of technology readiness, exploration and exploitation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
(this issue) 
“Exploring the impact of digital transformation on technology entre­
preneurship and technological market expansion: The role of technology 
readiness, exploration and exploitation” contributes to the special issue 
by exploring the effect of digital transformation on entrepreneurship 
and market expansion in the technology-driven business environment.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Related to this, the paper “A microfoundational perspective on SMEs’ 
growth in the digital transformation era” written by Scuotto et al.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
This means that individual digital capabilities matter for 
growth regardless of firm innovativeness.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Another literature review paper that is focused on the impact of 
digitalisation on business models was developed by Caputo et al.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
The authors draw on 
qualitative, in-depth interviews with three innovation teams dealing 
with digital technological innovations within separate telecom organi­
sations.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
They examine the impact of 
customer innovativeness, willingness to co-create, and customer 
involvement on their intention to adopt co-creatively developed new 
services through digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Effects and outcomes of digital transformation 
Finally, the fourth group of papers highlights some of the effects of 
digitalisation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Digital 
transformation, digital dividends and entrepreneurship: A quantitative analysis.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
It 
is particularly important as the concept of digital transformation has 
become a high priority for management in most sectors, offering new 
opportunities for entrepreneurship.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
On the other 
hand, a stream of studies has tried to explore the impact of digital trans­
formation on different business areas (Erevelles, Fukawa, & Swayne, 2016), 
business models (Alberti-Alhtaybat, Al-Htaybat, & Hutaibat, 2019; Loeb­
becke & Picot, 2015), business performances (Ferraris et al., 2019; Ferreira, 
Fernandes, & Ferreira, 2019) and required capabilities (Muninger, Ham­
medi, & Mahr, 2019; Warner & W¨ager, 2019).

text:
Creating an innovative digital project 
team: Levers to enable digital transformation.

text:
Building dynamic capabilities for digital trans­
formation: An ongoing process of strategic renewal.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Introduction 
Digital transformation has affected people, businesses and systems 
greatly in recent years (Del Giudice et al., 2020; Galindo-Martín, 
Casta˜no-Martínez, & M´endez-Picazo, 2019; Huarng, Yu, & Lai, 2015).
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Journal of Business Research 128 (2021) 204–210
209
related to digitalisation to increase firm value.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Recent studies 
demonstrate that innovation teams require a set of new skills, capabil­
ities, and mechanisms in order to integrate digital technologies in the 
innovation process (Guinan, Parise, & Langowitz, 2019).
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Searching for critical capa­
bilities affecting firms’ digital innovation” written by Tortora et al.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
The authors also shed light on how orga­
nisations can be digitally transformed, by suggesting that the digital 
transformation of traditional organisations is subject to their ability to 
learn, as well as to the interdependence that is developed between the 
strategic partners.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Shifting intra-and inter- 
organizational innovation processes towards digital business: An empirical analysis 
of SMEs.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Analysing 46 research ar­
ticles in depth, the authors show a strong interconnection between 
innovation and sustainability, highlighting how digital transformation 
tools contribute to the long-term value creation process.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
The authors also found that innovation was insignificant as a 
moderator of the relationship between individual digital capabilities and 
SME growth.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Statistics of the submissions 
This special issue received 95 submissions, from which we collected 
32 papers (the rejection rate was around 66%) with the aim of exploring 
how the current digital transformation is changing the way in which 
companies do business, with particular reference to innovation pro­
cesses and business model transformations.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
Based on data from a sample of 114 in­
ternational firms, the authors demonstrated the existence of a positive 
relationship, demonstrating how information about digitalisation is 
crucial in order for companies to increase their value.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
For 
example, from a business model perspective, it is necessary to explore 
how digital transformation and specific technologies can affect the key 
components of the business model, namely value creation, value 
configuration and value capture (Franceschelli, Santoro, & Candelo, 
2018).
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
This requires the attention of both managers and policy makers 
as regards overemphasising “digital” investments at the expense of 
innovation, because unbalanced decisions might lead to value destruc­
tion in the long run.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
We delivered key 
value around the main effects and outcomes of digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
The findings indicate that 
digital technologies may affect the efficiency of the process in the short 
term, but they are not drivers of innovation, especially of radical inno­
vation, in the long term.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
This study advances theoretical 
understanding of the dynamics of innovation teams, and conceptualises 
the ‘functioning of digital innovation teams’ by contextualising the 
cognition-process nexus within digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
These clusters provide evidence from a 
stakeholder-based view of how digital transformation takes places 
within this complex and fascinating industry.

text:
Also, digital technologies are idiosyncratic and they 
can easily become sunk costs that deplete firm’s flexibility and prevent 
the pursuit of innovation.

text:
Digital transformation is a constantly evolving issue and there are 
therefore still many answers to be provided for management.

products, services, and systems.

text:
The authors examine the actual influ­
ence of digital technologies on innovation performance in depth, by 
firstly better defining the concept of digital technologies, which em­
braces a diverse universe of artefacts, a series of clusters technologies 
that are extremely differentiated.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
In “Online information on digitalisation processes and its impact on 
firm value” Salvi et al.

text:
They suggest 
key propositions arguing that the relationship between alliance knowl­
edge and digital transformation is a necessary but not absolute condition 
for the digital transformation of traditional organisations.

In “The role of digital innovation in knowledge management sys­
tems: A systematic literature review” Di Vaio et al.

(this issue) is one of the first attempts to simultaneously 
consider strategic commitments towards digitalisation (digital orienta­
tion) and environmental sustainability (environmental orientation) as

tion performance.

These 
results clearly enrich the literature on digital transformation and, at the

(this

text:
In 
addition to interesting information on key journals and authors in this 
domain, they found three main thematic clusters: a) technological 
innovation, b) strategic management, and c) digital transformation.

Yet, there is 
limited understanding of the way team members interact and the tasks 
they perform to turn digital technologies into innovative outcomes for 
their organisation.

review of research articles published in the business and management 
literature within the last 20 years regarding digital transformation and 
healthcare.

text:
Specif­
ically, the paper first assesses the direct effects of digital and 
environmental orientations on the product and process innovation 
performance of SMEs.

text:
Despite this, we still know very little about how business 
can implement digital innovative strategies for growth and scale quickly 
and efficiently.

text:
Through the lens of Penrosian growth theory, 
their quantitative study reinforces the relevance of individual digital 
capabilities for SME growth by analysing 2,156,360 SMEs in 26 European 
countries.
metadata: title: Digital transformation as a springboard for product, process and business model innovation; author: Stefano Bresciani; creationDate: D:20210324161026Z; modDate: D:20210324173907Z; subject: Journal of Business Research, 128 (2021) 204-210. doi:10.1016/j.jbusres.2021.02.003

text:
The empirical results suggest that the relationships 
between skills, strategies and stakeholders and the dynamic capability 
are all strong and direct, without indirect interaction effects, meaning 
that Italian SMEs adopt innovative strategies independently from having 
strong digital-related skills.

that digital and environmental orientations, coeteris paribus, have a 
positive direct effect on the product and process innovation performance

The interplay 
between information technology systems and knowledge management

model of fixed- versus random-effect.

text: So, what is leadership in digital transformation?
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text: Digital transformation leadership characteristics.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text: Digital transformation strategies.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
A review of the literature has illustrated that characteristics 
such as digital strategist and digital architect have been established for a period of 
time, since 2001–2010, and continue to be mentioned as key characteristics for 
leaders and leadership undertaking a digital transformation programme in their 
organisations.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
How chief digital officers promote the digital transformation of their 
companies.

our answer to the research question in the form of eight characteristics of Digital

metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
In order to answer the research question posed in this paper (What are the character­
istics associated with Digital Transformation Leadership (DTL)?
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
This illustrates the importance of leaders to be strategic in their approach to digital 
transformation.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text: Distribution of Digital Transformation Leadership (DTL) Characteristics.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
So while decisions need to be made around digital transformation, as it is 
deployed across organisations, it is the leadership that must decide on the who and the 
what of these digital transformation programme implementations.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Research Question: What are the characteristics associated with Digital Transformation 
Leadership (DTL)?
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Hopefully, it represents 
a ‘benchmark for others.’The research conducted on the 87 journal and conference 
papers illustrates that there are certain characteristics that Digital Transformation 
Leadership (DTL) requires to deliver a digital transformation programme in an organisa­
tion.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
To answer this research question, we undertake a comprehensive review of 
Information Systems literature in order to develop an understanding of Digital 
Transformation Leadership as currently reported in the literature.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Leading digital transformation requires 
a professional with particular characteristics such technology and business, a vision of 
the future to be applied in the present, it doesn’t always require a CDO or CIO it can be the 
CMO (Chief Marketing Officer) (Tumbas et al., 2017).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The digital culturalist in digital transformation leadership ensures skillsets 
are on par from both internal and external sources (Dremel et al., 2017) and evolves the 
workforce through the acquiring of digital skills and competencies (G. C. Kane et al., 2015; 
Peppard et al 2016).

metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
3.2.1 Digital strategist
Based on our analysis of digital strategist, some of the concepts that inform the digital 
strategist and the decisions that need to be made are as follows: make digital transforma­
tion a strategic priority, advise the top management team on digital transformation, 
create and communicate a digital vision, change the organisational mindset, and adapt 
the approach to digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Options for formulating a digital transformation 
strategy.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
We must therefore 
understand what is critically important and we must appreciate what the leadership of 
a digital transformation programme are focusing on (c.f.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Instead 
of putting leadership on the shoulders of one individual (c-suite role) who espouses all 
eight DTL characteristics, we are suggesting that a leadership team needs to exist around 
a digital transformation programme.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

architect, customer centrist, organisational agilist, data advocate, business process opti­
miser and digital workplace landscaper.Each DTL characteristic consists of concepts that 
reflect the breadth and depth of leadership required and decisions to be made for 
a digital transformation programme to succeed.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
It is suggested that empirical research should now be undertaken to establish if 
Digital Transformation leaders share the same views around the DTL characteristics.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
It furthermore endeavours to allow leadership to cultivate atop down 
digital leadership approach (Eden et al., 2019) necessary to drive forward digital transfor­
mations across enterprises.

strategic partnership between IS and business leadership to adapt a digital transformation 
(Bharadwaj, El Sawy, Pavlou, Venkatraman et al., 2013; Singh & Hess, 2017 and Hess and

These leaders are responsible for taking a people, 
process, technology and data perspective on the digital transformation programme.

The role of the CIO and the CDO in an organization’s

The digital strategist creates a vision for digital transformation in a top – down manner 
enterprise-wide implementation (Singh & Hess, 2017, Dery et al 2016 and Hess and Matt 
2017).

focus on digital transformation leadership (DTL) among the Information Systems 
JOURNAL OF DECISION SYSTEMS

Table 2.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Being a digital culturalist embodies the need to act as a digital pioneer and native, have 
a digital mandate for change in their respective organisations, including creating new 
leadership roles such as the chief digital officer (Haffke et al., 2016; Horlacher et al., 2016 
and Singh et al Hess, 2017).The digital culturalist specialises in advocating, fostering and 
creating a digital culture and acting as a digital role model for the organisation (Granados 
& Gupta, 2013).

organization adapt to changes in the digital landscape’
Adapt the Approach to Digital 
Transformation (IS/IT and Business 
Alignment)
‘IS and business leaders realized they needed to adapt their 
approach to digital transformation in response to specific 
demands and opportunities that the participants perceived 
to be important for the organization’
JOURNAL OF DECISION SYSTEMS
11
3.2.2 Digital culturalist
Based on our analysis, some of the concepts that inform the digital culturalist and the 
decisions that need to be made are as follows: advocate and cultivate a passion for digital 
transformation, use an ambidextrous approach to foster a digital organisational culture, 
and develop skills and competencies in the workforce.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The leadership required to lead a Digital Transformation programme is perhaps 
greater than is anticipated, simply because, in many cases, the volume of changes 
within the business is unprecedented and making the right decision is not always 
JOURNAL OF DECISION SYSTEMS
25
a straight forward undertaking.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Changing the culture needs buy in from all sections and needs to include 
the philosophy of empowering employees to develop skills and competencies in digital 
transformation, this requires a digital evangelist to illustrate the benefits and challenges 
of digital transformation which can improve the organisation.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Successful digital 
transformation also requires clearly defined roles and responsibilities as well as top- 
management support which fosters ‘increased transparency through digitization’ 
(Dremel et al., 2017).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Are there other executive leadership types that 
are also suited to this role such as the CEO, CIO, CDAO (Chief Data & Analytics Officer) or 
CTO, who may be equipped with the necessary mandate to deliver change and overcome 
challenges that they will undoubtedly face during a digital transformation programme?
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
It is important that decisions are made to ensure that 
digital transformation leadership readiness is as good as it can be.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The digital workplace landscaperinvokes changes in the workplace through enterprise- 
wide digitalisation (MIS Quarterly Executive, 2016), changes in the workplace requires CEO 
and top management team supports using IT Leadership to manage digital workplace 
transformation rather than functional leaders (Dery et al 2016).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Irrespective of who leads on a digital transformation programme, as regards their role 
or title, it is more important to appreciate the DTL characteristics that are required to drive 
digital transformation in organisations.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Strategy, Not Technology, Drives 
Digital Transformation.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The CDO sees himself as a digital strategist, a digital advisor so creating 
a shared digital vision for the company, changing to a digital business model and 
developing a digital mindset across the organisation.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
3.2.5 Organisational Agilist
Based on our analysis, some of the concepts that inform the organisational agilist and the 
decisions that need to be made are as follows: embrace the need for positive organisa­
tional change, develop ambidexterity in the exploitation and exploration of resources for 
digital transformation and identify and hire suitably skilled people to implement digital 
transformation.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Our proposed DTL characteristics (the ‘what’) are highlighting the ‘values’ or ‘core 
traits’ that a leader (e.g., c-suite role) needs to possess to deliver a successful digital 
transformation programme.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text: Hospital Leadership in Support of Digital Transformation.

‘leadership’ or ‘digital leadership’ and ‘digital strategy’ and ‘digital transformation’, in 
either the title or abstract, was applied on June 2019 and December 2020.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
LEADERSHIP IN A DIGITAL ERA - IS “DIGITAL LEADERSHIP” A BUZZWORD OR 
A SIGNIFICANT PHENOMENON?
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
So far not much is known about the 
role leadership plays in a digital transformation undertaking and current literature has not 
adequately provided a comprehensive understanding of Digital Transformation 
Leadership (DTL).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Most likely this empirical work would produce 
a set of critical success factors to aid leaders and decision makers in their digital 
transformation programmes.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
This sentiment also holds 
through for digital transformation and the fact that leadership is such a key aspect to 
delivering digital transformation programme success.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
We conceptualise 
DTL across eight characteristics (the ‘what’) and further present an initial mapping of 
these characteristics to c-suite roles (the ‘who’), taxonomically (see Table 12).This work 
provides rich descriptive theorising of the phenomenon and generates interesting 
insights into the DTL characteristics that can help organisations to be more successful 
with their digital transformation programmes; for example, making decisions around 
these DTL characteristics requires an intuitive, decisive and informed leadership approach 
in areas such as digital vison and mindset, cross-functional connectedness and simplifica­
tion of operations, and resource evolution and overcoming barriers to change.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Creating a digital vision and mindset and communicating it 
in a top-down fashion coupled with creating, communicating and executing a digital 
strategy throughout the organisation are key elements of the role of the digital strategist.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
How big old 
companies navigate digital transformation.

ARTICLE HISTORY

1 Introduction
Digital Transformation has generated much research and curiosity in recent years from 
both an academic and practitioner perspective, not least in Information Systems (IS) 
research.

In 
some cases, the proposal of a DTO (Digital Transformation Officer) who motivates, 
orchestrates, and aligns digital initiatives has gained some popularity in recent times 
(Gimpel et al., 2018).

text:
Digitalization and leadership – How experienced leaders interpret daily realities in 
a digital world.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
However, it is hard to find a universally shared definition of 
digital transformation from the literature (Hansen et al., 2011; MIS Quarterly Executive,

text:
In 
fact, given the relatively small volume of research outputs on DTL over the past two 
decades, it may be a worthwhile approach to follow a Grounded Theory approach (data- 
to-theory) to identify the DTL characteristics from the experiences of Digital 
Transformation leaders (both operational and strategic) ‘in the trenches’.

text:
The CEO is pivotal to the success of digital 
transformation “because of its high level of complexity (Haffke et al., 2016).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Rapid adaptation in digital transforma­
tion: A participatory process for engaging IS and business leaders.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
To date, 
systematic reviews of digital transformation, focusing on its meaning, importance and 
effects on an organisation, while also highlighting the inconsistencies that exist in current 
literature, emanating from the definition of the term digital transformation, have been 
conducted (c.f.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The motivation for introducing a digital transformation 
programme can be multi-faceted, but, many digital transformation programmes are 
centred around changing the organisation’s structure and business model in order to 
serve existing customers more efficiently and reach new customers more effectively 
(Haffke et al., 2016; MIS Quarterly Executive, 2016).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
There is no doubt from our analysis that it is very difficult for one individual leader to be 
all encompassing when it comes to delivering a digital transformation programme.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The 
emergence of new leadership roles (Haffke et al., 2016; Horlacher et al., 2016) including 
the creation of a Chief Digital Officer (CDO) has been highlighted as being significant 
(Horlacher et al., 2016; Singh & Hess, 2017).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Designing for digital transformation: Lessons for 
information systems research from the study of ICT and societal challenges.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
This DTL characteristics are closely followed by being a digital architect, 
which illustrates the need for leaders and leadership to understand technology and 
innovation and what best fits the organisation when looking to digitally transform.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Given that the objective of this study is to generate a set of Digital Transformation 
Leadership (DTL) characteristics, content analysis was deemed an appropriate analysis 
approach.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
‘A truly 
successful digitalization will require full CEO attention and commitment’ (Bilgeri et al., 
2017) therefore the role needs to promote the idea that effective digitalisation and digital 
leadership require a different mindset and requires a ‘deep commitment to enterprise- 
wide digitalization’ (MIS Quarterly Executive, 2016).

text:
This involves 
prioritising digital transformation as a strategic objective by influencing top management 
to put it top of their agenda.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
It looks to simultaneously balance the exploitation and exploration of resources for 
a successful digital transformation implementation through hiring the right technical 
staff to implement it (Hess et al 2015, Weill et al 2013) which may require adapting 
their approach to digital transformation based on specific demands and opportunities 
identified (MIS Quarterly Executive, 2016).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Where literature does exist, DTL is understood as ‘doing the right things 
for the strategic success of digitalization for the enterprise and its business ecosystem’ 
(MIS Quarterly Executive, 2016, p. 142).Industry analysis suggests that less than 30% of 
digital transformation programmes succeed (c.f.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Current literature has not adequately 
provided 
a 
comprehensive 
understanding 
of 
Digital 
Transformation Leadership (DTL).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Interview with michael nilles on “What Makes Leaders Successful in the Age of 
the Digital Transformation?
entities: [('michael', 'PERSON'), ('What Makes Leaders Successful in the Age of \nthe Digital Transformation', 'WORK_OF_ART')]
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
4.1 Chief Digital Officer (CDO): -digital strategist, digital culturalist, digital 
architect, customer centrist, and digital workplace landscaper
The CDO (Chief Digital Officer), a new specialist role which has emerged in many 
organisations.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
This 
involves advocating and cultivating a passion for digital transformation and fostering an 
ambidextrous approach to creating a digital culture in the organisation which can be 
embraced top down and bottom up, where both management and employees are 
receptive of it.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Stages in digital business transformation: Results of an empirical 
maturity study.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The CDO is primarily an evangelist, 
a digital culturalist, whose mission it is to ‘ take the organization on a digital change 
journey and sensitize people that the world as we know it will not exist for long’ (Haffke 
et al 2017).The CDO role can be centralised at the group level or decentralised at the 
subsidiary level but their priority is to make digital transformation a strategic priority in 
their companies (Singh & Hess, 2017).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Notwithstanding this, the emergence of the CDO represents the widespread view of the 
need to appoint a specialist to take charge of digitally transforming the business (Haffke 
et al., 2016).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Matt 2017; Hess et al., 2016).The digital strategist is tasked with value creation and enhan­
cing stakeholders value propositions across many organisations (Fitzgerald et al 2013 and 
Berman et al 2012) and increases transparency through digitalisation at every stage of its 
implementation and with the power of instrumentation leaders will lead and manage using 
digitalisation (Bennis 2013, MIS Quarterly Executive, 2016; Granados & Gupta, 2013).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Weritz, P., Braojos, J., & Matute, J., “Exploring the Antecedents of Digital Transformation: 
DynamicCapabilities and Digital Culture Aspects to Achieve Digital Maturity“ (2020).
entities: [('Braojos', 'PERSON'), ('J., & Matute', 'ORG'), ('Exploring the Antecedents of Digital Transformation', 'WORK_OF_ART'), ('DynamicCapabilities', 'ORG'), ('Digital Culture Aspects', 'ORG'), ('2020', 'DATE')]
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Therefore, 87 research papers that explicitly mentioned 
digital transformation and leadership, and were scientific peer-reviewed empirical 
research papers were analysed.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Aligning with new digital strategy: A dynamic capabilities 
approach.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Notwithstanding this and even more challenging though is the leader­
ship that is needed to guide the people within the business through the Digital 
Transformation journey.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
However, it also highlights the need for digital transformation leadership to be considered 
a team sport and further highlights the mix of c-suite roles that should combine to ensure 
that all the DTL characteristics are in play.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
As presented in Table 4, strategy, mindset and 
achieving top management support is central to digital transformation.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The digital architect creates operational excellence by exploring and exploiting digital 
technology foundations for digital transformation (Nwankpa & Roumani, 2016; Singh & 
Hess, 2017) for systems integration through agile and scalable digital operations.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Eden, R., Burton-Jones, A., Casey, V., & Draheim, M. (2019) Digital and Workforce Transformation Go 
Hand-in-HandManagement Information Systems Quarterly Executive (2019).

text:
So, for example, being a digital strategist or a data advocate 
are fundamental DTL characteristics for certain c-suite roles (the ‘who’).One could say it is 
no surprise that a number of c-suite roles have emerged as potential digital leaders from 
our analysis of the literature.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
community and practitioner focused outputs are much more prolific than more aca­
demic focused outputs
3.2 DTL characteristics
While there are many factors that can impact on the successful implementation of 
a digital transformation programme, none can have as much influence as ‘skilled and 
competent leadership’ (c.f.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Crossing boundaries: Organization design parameters 
surrounding CDOs and their digital transformation activities.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Others, such as the Chief Technical Officer (CTO), the Chief Data & Analytics Officer 
(CDAO), the Chief Innovation Officer (CINO) and Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) emerge 
as playing a very specific leadership role with a digital transformation programme.

text: Digital strategist concepts.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
‘Chief Data 
Officers thus focus on just one organizational capability within the digital realm: big 
data, but the scope of the CDAO role is much broader and not confined to this one 
specific area of digital transformation’ (Singh & Hess, 2017).The chief data and sometime 
analytics officer is a strategist, architect, organisational agilist and customer centrist in the 
data domain (Lee et al.,).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The CDO can be customer centrist focused on using new digital technologies to 
enhance the customer experience across all customer touch points, creating a ‘360 
degree’ customer experience across all customer touch points (Singh & Hess, 2017)
4.2 Chief Information Officer (CIO): -digital strategist, digital culturalist, digital 
architect, organisational agilist and business process optimiser
The CIO (Chief Information Officer), the acknowledged head of IT in an organisation is 
generally viewed as having many digital transformation characteristics.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
So while achieving transformation success is 
linked to having certain digital-savvy leaders in place, less than one-third of organisations 
have engaged a CDO to support their transformations (“McKinsey,” 2018).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text: The digital workplace is key to digital innovation.

text:
As presented in Table 8, the organisational agilist will develop the 
approach for the organisation to implement digital transformation through exploring 
and exploiting the necessary resources and how that organisational change will be 
governed successfully.

(Singh & Hess, 2017).

As illustrated in Figure 1, the earliest published paper in an IS journal, which 
addressed Digital Transformation Leadership (DTL), appeared in MISQ (a senior scholars’ 
basket of eight journals) in 2003.

text:
More 
specifically, thereafter, the focus of the coding and analysis was on the ‘who’ (referring to 
the leader or leadership function in digital transformation) and the ‘what’ (referring to the 
activities of digital transformation leadership).
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Like all types of change programmes, digital transformation can be understood to 
alter the people, process, technology and data components of an organisation (Hansen 
et al.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
So where the primary goal of a literature review is ‘to classify what has been 
produced by the literature’(Rowe, 2014, p. 243), we believe that we have achieved this for 
Digital Transformation Leadership (DTL) characteristics (see Figure 4).

As 
a result, we contend that both the digital strategist and digital architect are established 
characteristics of DTL.

can also be viewed as digital architect, by monitoring and managing the introduction of

text:
Thereafter, the organisational agilist, digital culturalist and custo­
mer centrist are viewed as belonging to the emergent category of DTL characteristics, as 
illustrated by the organisational change that has transpired in recent times from the 
exploitation of digital resources both human and physical; and the improved customer 
collaboration and experience through the optimisation of digital services.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
Our 
analysis identifies eight DTL characteristics, namely: digital strate­
gist, digital culturalist, digital architect, customer centrist, organisa­
tional agilist, data advocate, business process optimiser and digital 
workplace landscaper.
metadata: title: Digital Transformation Leadership Characteristics: a Literature Analysis:; author: Patrick McCarthy; creationDate: D:20210414115327-07'00'; modDate: D:20210415002623+05'30'; subject: Journal of Decision Systems, 2021. doi:10.1080/12460125.2021.1908934; keywords: Digital transformation; leadership; open coding; literature analysis; taxonomy; c-suite

text:
The business process optimiser during digitalisation must optimise business or func­
tions performance by abandoning the ‘divide and conquer mindset’ typical of many large 
organisations, integration is critical for digital transformation to be a success across these 
organisations (Ross et al 2016).

quently in the role of a digital strategist (Singh & Hess, 2017).
